column2: Definitely a classic game you won't regret getting!

let me be perfectly clear here, this is a masterpiece of a game, it is 100% worth the money, just be wary of the very toxic online community and if you can play with friends. but that isnt why im leaving a negative review
the reason is that out of the blue the game decided to stop launching on steam at all, i have tried restarting steam, restarting my pc, verified game file integrity, checked for windows updates, etc, NONE of these measures have done anything meaning this game no longer works and i have no f#cking idea why and how to fix it, steam support has not been helpful at all
if anyone has idea's on how to fix this issue feel free to comment here, until i can actually play the game i payed for again this review will stay negative.

smh bad game 

back 4 blood is way better
Excellent, I still pop into it every once and a while to play with friends or a modded game of only tanks.

I am a 49 yo dad, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 18 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2019 from his cousin, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had over 70 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character (Louis) and started playing but I was too old for modern technologies so I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and we also spend time outside the house together as well. unfortunately in 2021 my son got COVID-19 and we lost his battle. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything and Those we have held in our arms for a little while, we hold in our hearts forever. Left4dead2 has brought both me and my Son many happy memories..
When I started playing this on Xbox when it came out its super fun especially with coop, on PC its even better because of mods so it can be customized to your liking.

I remember when I was 11 years old, and I was afraid of roller coasters. I made a deal that for every  roller coaster I ride, I can buy anew game. I managed to ride 2 roller coaster so I was able to get 2 new games. They were the original Ghostbusters game, and Left 4 Dead 2. I absolutely loved this game, so simple (at the time), and amazing with friends. As the years go on, this game stays being a masterpiece. My friends always talk about what makes games great, and we all keep saying that even the most simple things can satisfy the most picky gamers
You either gonna have time of your life, or get cyberbullied. 10/10

One of my first Steam games and my go to coop game for years. Steam must not have been counting hours in the early days because there's no way I ONLY have 127 hours in. Coming back all these years later I have to mention, the game still holds up well. Graphics are good, the Hard Rain level is still incredibly impressive and I feel like it really needs an award for being the best Zombie Shooter that's ever been made. Don't get me wrong, Killing Floor 2 is really really good but it just doesn't have the same intensity that this game provides. Not sure why nobody else has really been able to master hordes of enemies that go down easy but its obviously the best way to do it. I always thought it was weird how quickly they came out with this sequel and then, nothing. Apparently Back 4 Blood is its spiritual successor and after replaying this I'm going to have to find a copy of that game and give it a try.

Another thing I was happy to find upon replaying this game is that the modding community has been going gangbusters over the last decade. It's pretty awesome to see Duke Nukem, Spiderman, Ashley Williams and Harley Quinn running around as a team fighting zombies together. Really not much else to say, playing with other people is far more enjoyable but not required and aside from taking med kits way before they need to the AI is pretty good. Plus the price is right, there's really no reason not to give it a try. Note L4D 1 is also really good but this game has all of the levels and characters from that game so there's really no reason to go back to the first one.
This is very fun to play with your friends

I love this game. Lately I see people loving it mainly for next to unlimited mods on workshop. I prefer vanila game, but it does not matter. What matter is that this game is so timeless, that you can still compare it to games made today (2022) and it throws punches. I wish there was Left 4 Dead 3 on VR or something. Because this franchise just works.

Left 4 Dead 2 is easily one of my top video games, ever.

The campaigns alone are such a joy to replay countless times again and again. And once you're bored with those, you can search the workshop for some incredibly well made custom made maps. They can be difficult at times but that's one of the reason to play them since they pose challenges different from the base game. Other modes to choose from like PvP and Survival are there for you as well. Wanna shake up the rules a little? Activate a couple of mutations to spice things up.

Even if you get bored of the regular dark, moody look of the game, the workshop is there for you to turns things all kinds of weird. The workshop offers all sorts of cool, cute and hilarious cosmetic changes to props and models that just make the game that much more amusing. Wanna turn your teammates into anime girls? Go right ahead. Wanna beat zombies to death with a giant lollipop? I can't say for sure, but you could probably do that too :p

Since this game is over a decade old, there are some things here that wouldn't fly with today's standard of games. Badly smoothed maps will cause your character to get caught on the stupidest, smallest of shit that will often times result in you getting killed if you're running from an enemy. Subpar A.I teammates will never fail to let you down when you're pinned by an enemy and they won't hesitate to burn themselves alive in a fire and make you watch. It's hard to overlook these flaws but remember that this game came out in 2009. Standards were much different back then. Is any of this going to change or be improved? No. Valve have got better, newer things to worry about.

However, that shouldn't discourage you from playing this masterpiece. I've had hours and hours of fun alone and with friends, enjoying the wonder of killing zombies. Left 4 Dead 2 has etched itself into video gaming history as one of the greatest games on the face of the earth. It's not even expensive. Give it a go.

Oh and don't bother with Left 4 Dead 1. It's obsolete.
very fanny game yes buy for you and friends play much very good

I have been playing the Left 4 Dead series since it first came out and is a dear childhood game to me. It has always been a great experience, even with the issues and annoyances. Being able to mod it on Steam in a way that is extremely easy makes it even more fun with friends. I will always recommend this game to people.

still waiting on that cheese burger apocalypse

I am a 97 year old pet owner, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single caretaker to my labrador, who is now 2. My dog recently downloaded L4D2 and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my dog, as he is always outside chasing the neighbours cat or just watching twerking videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my dog for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my dog since my paint stopped drying. This game has ever since brought my dog and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my dog many happy memories.

I originally got this game from my friend who wanted it for garrys mod content(then realized how fun it was) it was an amazing time and helped give us something else to do now here is my review:

This is a fantastic game where it is cheap with tons of content. I am going to go through each seperate part of the game which makes it so good

Graphics:
As for all old Valve games for its time this game looks wonderful (however blood and gore in zombies is overdone quite a bit such as a pistol shot causes there leg to explode or top front skin to disappear)
The campaigns are well made graphic-wise and The atmosphere is just...wow

Requirements:
Can run  on most mid machines sometimes on low tier but the crazy scenes will cause lag

Gameplay:

Absolutely fantastic. The entire point in the campaigns is really go from point A to point B but its well done.each campaign has a certain amount of parts each part a point  A to point B except the last part which has a special goal(such as survive a certain amount of time or fuel the engines)then they end.There are around a dozen campaings an hour each and are easily replay-able There are a ton of guns and other weapons to find and choose from as well as different grenades.The most interesting part is the fact that there are 4 playable characters and extras(because your friends can take the place of some and unless you activate something that disables them)will become AI'S which will help you.The zombie hordes go from a few to a couple dozen to what feels like HUNDREDS which gets REALLY confusing and difficult.

Story:

This is A game mainly for its gameplay the story however is not worth it it gets confusing and ends abruptly but the campaigns from both 1 and 2 are in here meaning you get double the content
  
Community:

Dont look in the community it is BEYOND toxic and the Online co-op is filled with cheaters modders and players who will kill you and leave you for dead because you accidentally damaged allies while blinded so just play with your friends thats all you need

Conlusion:
Great game recommend to all players but CAUTION PLAYERS WHO ARE SENSITIVE TO BLOOD OR INTENSE LANGUAGE AVOID THIS TITLE

Charles White Jr.[4] (born August 2, 1994), better known as Cr1TiKaL (pronounced "critical"), is an American YouTuber and Twitch streamer. Best known for his commentary videos on YouTubeâ€”as well as his live streams on Twitch, where he most often streams gaming contentâ€”his content is distinguishable for his monotone voice and deadpan delivery of comedic commentary.[5] In addition, White is a co-founder and co-owner of esports organization Moist Esports and co-founder and member of musical duo The Gentle Men.

As of August 2022, White's YouTube channel has gained over 5.6 billion video views and over 11.2 million subscribers, averaging 151.4 million views per month on the platform;[6] his Twitch channel has gained over 4.3 million followers and over 59.3 million views.[7][8]

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.

I would absolutely recommend playing this is you were a fan of the games on the Xbox 360! 
I had all of the achievements for this game when I played it originally and working to get them again has ben a fun, nostalgic challenge. :D

The main downside is that since this is on Steam, there are a lot of hackers/griefers which can immediately ruin your experience due to aim botting, speed hacking, etc. 

Outside of getting achievements or playing online with friends, I would say to try and avoid playing the Versus game modes unless you're okay with dealing with random cheaters.

Regardless, it's still really fun and the option to mod stuff is always neat!

The end of the world - is not going to end! Crowds of the dead are attacking cities, destroying all living things that come their way. You are in the company of a few survivors and decide to take a desperate step - to get to the evacuation point.
Difficult tests await you! But teamwork is the key to survival!

[list][b]Pros:[/b]
[*]+ Single player mode with bots
[*]+ Co-op game mode
[*]+ Achievements
[*]+ Excellent graphics
[*]+ Lots of official scenarios
[*]+ Thousands of modifications and maps from the community
[*]+ A variety of weapons
[*]+ Trading cards
[*]+ Multiple game modes
[*]+ Global statistics
[*]+ New (and old) heroes!
[*]+ Ability to play as Zombies!

[b]Minuses:[/b]
[*]- Not the friendliest community[/list]

[b]Total:[/b]
An excellent cooperative action game for 4 players (and more - on modified community maps), in which you can have fun in the company of friends / casual acquaintances.
A lot of maps give you the opportunity to try yourself in a variety of scenarios, from classic difficulties to a real apocalypse, when several dozen Tanks attack you at the same time.
Unfortunately, sometimes the game is spoiled by the players themselves - which deliberately destroy the allies.
The game is recommended for the acquisition and passage of a fun company.

Left 4 Dead 2 is a great game even all these years later, it's always fun to jump in with some friends and play the campaigns, and the amount of workshop support in this game is insane too, you can make anybody and anything into basically whatever you want.
The only bad part about this game in my opinion is the Versus gamemode (Which personally I play alot of) because around 70% of the community are very toxic people that are not welcoming new players.

I used to think this game was nice when I was younger.
After playing it years later, I came to the conclusion that not only this game isn't as nice as people remember, it actually sucks a lot.
The maps are terribly designed. The game itself is supposed to have a linear campaign, but the maps are too badly designed for the player to know where's he's supposed to go. Only after a lot of trial, hitting a dead-end, turning back and getting swarmed, you'll come to understand the maps and actually have some enjoyment from it. "Just adding more zombies to the maze" isn't a solution for difficulty escalation either.
Having to play your entire game to only then have fun playing it is a very bad design choice.
I used to like this game, now I regret buying it for my friend. It sucks ass and only now I came to this conclusion. This game has clearly been made lazily.
Screw you, Valve.

My team was winning, not by much...a couple hundred points. The other team had quite a few "questionable" shots. Through a wall the instant you spawned as a Boomer, killing you while charging straight at them even though there was very little breathing room, picking a Hunter out of mid air with pistols at a crazy distance... (They were by the tent at the beginning of dead center 2 and they managed to pistol kill a Hunter trying to get away by pouncing down the street. Hunter was near the police car down there.)

Whatever. Spectating them looked as though they were always getting headshots, but they *were* missing from time to time. All of them grabbed pistols and sniper rifles whenever they got the chance.

Scores stayed pretty even until the finale of Dead Center. My survivor team played first and we managed only 5 cans. We had a NONSTOP horde. I literally mean nonstop once the finale started. To our discredit, we did play kinda sloppy.

Anyway, 5 cans. We figured they'd need at least 8-9 to beat us.

Cue their finale. No zombies. I mean...none. It was like the Last Man on Earth mutation and I'm not exaggerating either.

But the kicker was...

When they all noclipped and flew up to the top of the mall out of reach of any of us on the infected side. Nick flew to a gas can, poured it in, and suddenly, they had 13 cans in. Full points. They all flew back to the car, and they won the round. It happened in a matter of seconds.

Why are people such losers!?
Fix this game, VALVE!!!

End of rant.

This game is a classic Xbox 360 first person zombie shooter. Very enjoyable with and without mods. Easy to mod through the steam workshop, makes customizing your experience much easier in the long run. Personally this is a game I've put at minimum 1,000 hours into between PC and Xbox and the additions of game modding, character modding, and even sound modding, has helped keep me coming back to play over a decade later. I recommend the Tank Run lobbies especially (in the mutations tab) because in times where I was not able to play with me friends, I found new ones in there. 10/10 game. Even though it's barely had updates in the last few years my enjoyment has not faded and I'm sure any newcomers to the game will also feel the same if not similar!

I grew up playing a lot of Left 4 Dead on the Xbox 360. It's nice to come back to it after all these years have passed. It's a great game. The only reason you shouldn't have already played this...is if you didn't have a PC or Xbox during the time. Still in 2022..this game is great. Also, playing it with mods has added even more fun to this already great game. Was more than worth the money. 

My only issue with the game (Which might not be an issue with others.) is that it doesn't come with splitscreen built into the base game. My sibling and I were trying to relive the L4D days while adding mods. It's great there are even mods to fix that issue. 

tl:dr 
It's Left 4 Dead. You should know what it is...you shouldn't be reading reviews. You should be playing it. No one should even have to recommend this. lol

Left 4 Dead 2 is a classic 4 Player Co Op or Solo Zombie Survival, the Normal Modes you go Point A to Point B and in the final level of each stages you have to survive, or played Survival to time how long you can last.

Thanks to Workshop the Game have more replayability time and time again, you can change the models, sounds music and etc. Getting tired of same old L4D2? no worries just boot up Workshop and explore the Addons world.

in a nutshell L4D2 is a great game to play with Friends XD
Fun game to chill and play with friends, damn chargers are annoying tho

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
it is a good game really fun so i recommend

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I've played the original Left 4 Dead back in the day and after years of waiting and saving up for a laptop or console of my own, I finally got to play Left 4 Dead 2 and it blows the first game out of the water. Not only does it have new campaigns, weapons, special infected, and survivors, but it also includes the originals campaigns and survivors from the first game. Plus L4D2 includes Steam Workshop support. This game truly is an improvement of the first game and still does its own thing.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 18 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

Fine. 72/100 is what Iâ€™d give this game. It kinda' matches my achievements percentage. I don't need any more achievements from this particular game tho, since the rest is competitive ones and I don't play vs-modes in games.
      75/100 for the Fun and variety - let's grab the weapons and let's roll, let's crush the zombies, the Shotguns, the Tank, the M60, the AK-47, military sniper, molotovs, hell, yeah...! 
      89/100 for the Community - players, mods. Most players are good people, at least they play well and behave adequately. There are trolls, but it's rare. It is one idea more frequent than usually though, this game has versus and games with it have times bigger count of trolls and I mean, you might encounter those even in solo & coop games, but this is just the way it is, ehh. Mods are fine, everyone can find s.th. for himself, would it be just some cosmetics or hard-modding. I use just like 1/1000 of the mods of the workshop, but this is just what I need. If it was for the global conversions & custom maps, the 89/100 assessment 'd be like 40-50/100 tho. I mean, Valve have failed to balance the game well, what to say for just some rookie "pro-player" modders?
      44/100 for the difficulty balance (58/100 for coop & 30/100 for solo) - with the madness that special infected can cause, game simply loses some value, especially when it comes to jockeys and smokers, that totally mess up with the gameplay. You can be dragged and smashed, pulled, pounced, cornered, entangled, ridden till death, thrown out-of the map out of the nothing, overwhelmed and so on. Trust me, just start with easy, then normal, after that advanced, and aaafter that expert and mb other game modes. This really isn't the type of game you want to keep playing solo all-the time as well. I wonder, why, instead of fixing some glitches that help bypassing the madness of this game, don't you, dear L4D staff go fix those friendly AI and mb give them some more advanced capabilities, like being able to use melee, instructing them to stay/follow, use grenades and such? Huh? Why should I use mods for this thing? Come on, you can do way better with your updates. In fact, what kills the balance partially comes from the vs-mode. Devs try to make game more-balanced for all (solo, coop, vs), which kills the balance of each one separately. If the game had no versus mode, it would likely feel better.
      50/100 is what I'd give to Steam's counting playing hours. Seriously, I have 300-400 hours overall and I am tired of my afk-time during solo & menus being counted as playing hours, ROFL. Wake up, Steam, is it Valve doing this?
      88/100 is for Picture quality & beauty - it is very good for a game with those years (It's from 2008-L4D1 and 2009-L4D2)
      70/100 is for Options & basic tweaking - they are partially fine, but there are some important features lacking. Why the hell should I randomly be sentenced to play as a female character??? They could easily avoid that and create more characters/change game lore a bit, so that I can always chose what to play, I am a boy, damn, I don't want Rochelle/Zoey. And why can't I tweak light properly, I don't wanna be blinded by sun rays. FPS-options are mostly fine tho. And trust me, remove ALL film grain. It is garbage.
      67/100 for the Sounds & music. Believe it or not, the 33/100 I take away is mainly for the survivors talking trash. Even worse, there are mods like vox, which allows players to trashtalk at will via character quotes and spam cries, blabbing, taunting, lying and whatsoever and with such a mod in the hands of trollish people, game becomes worse. There is a mod that mutes every single survivor separately and you can use just subtitles, but even it has some sharp weaknesses and issues.
      With the above being said, playing this game with 100+ ping is an innaturally bad idea, so press that tab button and if the connection isn't fine in the borders of 20 seconds, you'd better either fix your internet/stop all downloads & uploads, or just instantly leave the game. Not kidding, I mean, this game might seem irresponsive at times even when you are hosting, not to mention when ping is high. Pushing the shove button/cutting melee leading to nothing is typical, you still might be downed from a hunter, hanged by a smoker, ridden by jockey and more $h1t like that. Funny, isn't it? Or well...is it?
      For now, I can give L4D some pause, playing it less intensively from now on and play some other, better games. Might do some Realism- & Mutation games from time to time, but can delay that as well. Game isn't too hooking. It's mediocre for solo and between fine and good for coop. If it wasn't for the community of players, game wouldn't be as "progressive".

The game is a classic that stands the test of time, though that could admittedly be nostalgia talking. Graphics remain beautiful; the gunplay feels smooth and offers a better degree of tension than Back 4 Blood; the carefully crafted animations and degree of environmental interaction make the world feel more alive and "real" than many modern games. The fact that it can run so well on modest (by modern standards) hardware just makes it a no-brainer of a buy.
That's ten bucks and about 160 hours of my life I don't even want back.

One of the best zombie games hands down. I find myself coming to this game all the time if I'm bored or if I have nobody to play with. The game offers a singleplayer option but mainly encourages multiplayer and teamwork over all else. It is genius how they get the player to play cooperatively and be a good teammate. Sure, there's gonna be the occasional person who knows all the strats and just runs ahead and quits anytime they die, but usually people are very helpful.

This game does zombies differently than other games and it is one of the only zombie games that seems to try to make things interesting. It presents itself as if you were playing a movie, and these movie details are found everywhere, the poster loading screens, spotlights, and overall the somewhat cheesy zombie flick feeling. However, this game is anything but cheesy if you ask me. Most zombie games focus on either action or enforcing a feeling of vulnerability, Left 4 Dead does both. For the most part you are seemingly an unstoppable killing machine to the common infected, mowing down several zombies in just a few shots, but that's why the special infected exist. The special infected are the main show in the game, they designed either to savagely tear your health away shockingly quickly or they are designed to separate you from your team. All of them are completely counterable on your own, however the massive hordes of zombies and the other specials around will likely catch you off guard and prevent you from countering them.

The map design in this game is excellent and very smart, it carries the typical valve principle of combining realistic areas with otherworldly scenarios, in this case it is a road trip from Savanna Georgia down to New Orleans. There are 6 campaigns, each of which are divided into about 5 or 6 separate short levels that are usually quite diverse, and all of them are pretty interesting and usually have some kind of overall theme or gimmick. 

Dead Center is the introduction and also the most forgiving campaign, giving you any weapon you want halfway through, The Passing is a short but sweet sendoff to the old L4D1 survivors, Dark Carnival is generally the most iconic campaign with the most unique assets and memorable setpieces, Swamp Fever is... a swamp, Hard Rain is a testament to valve level design by travelling through several notable areas and returning through them in a hurricane with different routes to avoid being slowed by the water, and the Parish is a continuous series of tests of what you've learned throughout the game as well as a masterful display of storytelling.

Left 4 Dead 2's gameplay loop is very fun and replayable with the randomize weapon spawns and the powerful game director AI that changes the levels on the fly to adjust the map to your performance, giving you usually enough, but not necessarily generous either. I would recommend this to anyone who loves zombie games and also loves extremely fast-paced gameplay.

I am a 14 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 2. My son recently started playing L4D2 and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to download this game and to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game but I was stuck on what you were supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I have a tendency to try to 100% a game before making a review stating how much I enjoy/enjoyed it; and I can proudly say I did so prior to creating a final opinion on Left 4 Dead 2 as a game.

Left 4 Dead is probably one of the best FPS games I've played through In a long time. It is heavily teamwork based, ensuring that you must have good communication skills with your fellow team-mates if you want to be successful in any map you play on regardless if your playing as a survivor or infected (versus). The game is able to keep this cooperative play style while remaining entertaining and keeping you actively doing things; such as gathering cans in scavenge, watching out for enemy players in versus, or just trying to survive as long as possible in survival.
After obtaining all achievements and gathering almost 150 hours as of reviewing this, I can safely say Left 4 Dead 2 is a genuinely solid game and I will continue to play it because of such.
5/5

Where do I start?
The gameplay, the atmosphere, everything is perfect. From the level design, once populated areas are now run down and filled with infected. The only evidence of humans existing are the abandoned cars, cluttered rooms at disarray from panic, frantic scrawlings from other survivors on walls, makeshift safe rooms, rotting corpses, and many, many posters depicting the spread of the green flu. All this plus more adds up to each level feeling very memorable and different.
Sound is everything too. The music perfectly matches what you are experiencing from the eerie tones after leaving the saferoom letting you know there is no turning back, intense and all over the place music each level has when being surrounded by infected, the frantic and dizzying sounds of being covered in bile perfectly matching the fact that the bile has blinded you and you dont know what's happening, to the ending jingle after reaching a saferoom filling you relief knowing you made it by the skin of your teeth. And not to mention the ambient sounds like the mumbles and punches of nearby Infected infighting, to the chatter of your teammates, the screeches of an upcoming horde, to the crys of each special infected.

This co-operative action horror FPS takes you and your friends through the cities, swamps and cemeteries of the Deep South, from Savannah to New Orleans across five expansive campaigns.
You'll play as one of four new survivors armed with a wide and devastating array of classic and upgraded weapons. In addition to firearms, you'll also get a chance to take out some aggression on infected with a variety of carnage-creating melee weapons, from chainsaws to axes and even the deadly frying pan.
You'll be putting these weapons to the test against (or playing as in Versus) three horrific and formidable new Special Infected. You'll also encounter five new Â“uncommonÂ” common infected, including the terrifying Mudmen.
Helping to take L4D's frantic, action-packed gameplay to the next level is AI Director 2.0. This improved Director has the ability to procedurally change the weather you'll fight through and the pathways you'll take, in addition to tailoring the enemy population, effects, and sounds to match your performance. L4D2 promises a satisfying and uniquely challenging experience every time the game is played, custom-fitted to your style of play. Left 4 Dead 2 features intense violence, blood and gore (including decapitation or dismemberment of zombie-like creatures) and some strong language.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding  vintage chocolate chip cookies recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients
150g salted butter, softened
80g light brown muscovado sugar
80g granulated sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 large egg
225g plain flour
Â½ tsp bicarbonate of soda
Â¼ tsp salt
200g plain chocolate chips or chunks
Method
STEP 1
Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper.

STEP 2
Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy.

STEP 3
Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg.

STEP 4
Sift 225g plain flour, Â½ tsp bicarbonate of soda and Â¼ tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon.

STEP 5
Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well.

STEP 6
Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies.

STEP 7
Bake for 8â€“10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them.

STEP 8
Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack.

RECIPE TIPS
FREEZING THE BISCUITS
If youâ€™ve frozen the biscuits, take them out and arrange them on a lined baking sheet. Once defrosted, pop them in a medium oven 190C/170 fan/gas mark 5 and heat for 2-3 mins to crisp up. Donâ€™t leave them too long or theyâ€™ll dry out.
STORING DOUGH
You can keep the uncooked dough in a sealed container in the fridge for up to two weeks. Simply take some out, dollop on a lined baking tray and allow to come up to room temperature for 5 mins before baking

I gave thus thumbs down, as it looks very much pay to win (or pay until you realized you've been had). The UI links you to the shop everywhere and prices are insane, given how many tokens you need to finish the game. The game has very little content, and you should be able to get through that content in reasonable time, without having to pay more than $5 at the most. As it is, you need to invest thousands of real time hours or pay $1000+ to get through it, which just sounds like a scam.

Enough about that. The game is free to play, so feel free to try it out yourself. You can play through a lot of the limited content without paying anything. You just need to know when to stop, and be able to ignore that you can't get the best staff and the best club upgrades.

The game is kind of split in two. In one part you're doing a shift in the club. Where all you basically do is: Click on drinks to make drinks, give drinks to people to earn money. Get helper to bring you more drinks from fridge or clean a table. Order strippers to do strip shows. Once you buy private boots you open up the possibility of giving customers lap dances when they request it too. That's it. As you upgrade club you get more customers, so you need to click more, and as you get more staff and upgrade them so they move faster you need to click faster. So in that fashion it's sort of Space Invaders in a strip club context. Just that there's never game over. Errors just mean your income gets less than optimal, so it's no big deal. Especially when you get on a bit and money is basically worthless because everything costs tokens instead. As time goes by, the only way to get tokens is through levelups, so a shift is basically about getting as many stars as possible to level up as quick as possible, meaning strip shows and lap dances are your primary goal, and earning money a secondary goal.

The second part is upgrading the club through money and tokens earned. To begin with, most upgrades cost money you earn in game, but once you get to level ~40, almost all further upgrades just require tokens, and money becomes pretty useless (Apart from a few high prices money sinks opening up later) This second part would be much more interesting if you knew more about what upgrades did, so you could make informed decisions rather than upgrade on instincts.

The game is pretty much about levelling up. That is, get stars from strip shows and lap dances until you level up. To begin with you'll level up every 2 shifts, and at level 50-60 it seems this starts to slow down, and you may need 3 shifts to level up. At level ups you get some rewards. Mostly money and tokens, but sometimes also unlock a photo, get access to an extra staff member, extra booze or get one XP for a staff member. At levelups you also may trigger some small story conversations.

Initially, you can get some tokens from achievements, but these are once only events, so once you have gotten the easy to get ones, that stream will shut. The free spin of the wheel gives hardly anything, so you're pretty much locked to the rewards you get on levelup as time passes. You can earn more stars as you get better staff and upgrade club, but you need more star points to advance too, so while awards increase with each level, due to the extra effort to get to the next level, the rewards feel fairly constant.

Grinding tokens from level ups is fine, if you can stand the grind. Not being able to get all the upgrades when you dont pay is also ok. But the real issue, is the lack of goals. There's a limit to how many hundred shifts I can handle just to see the story progress a bit. When you open up a dirty picture, that feels like a reward, but as you have to pay extra tokens to actually unlock it piece by piece, you feel like you rather need to invest in club/staff upgrades, so they are easy to skip, and then what are you playing for?

Also feels rough to grind hours to get tokens to do an upgrade, and then you buy a gacha in hopes of getting access to better staff, and waste 55 tokens to get a staff upgrade of a staff member you're not using worth 1-2 tokens. Or you pay 75000 to upgrade the club, but all that changes is that the club seems to have a second floor in the overview picture, but nothing in the club actually changes. And a lot of the upgrades within the club have no written or obvious in game effect. Might do nothing for all I know.

Some suggestions for game changes to make it better:
- When you unlock photos or other lewd stuff, don't require tokens to access it further.
- When you pay for gacha and get an XP point, at least get a full level so you level up. I have yet to get a staff member that is level 2 at level 60.
- Allow you to buy tokens for in game cash, so cash still feels useful.
- More story points. More sexy content. (That doesn't cost you tokens)
- Reduce token requirements, and especially reduce rate at which costs increase. And drastically reduce prices of tokens. Are you really expecting people to buy tokens for $1000 and feel ok with it? Using $5 on this game, should give you all you need to see all the little content there is in here.
- Animations that don't require you to press the mouse x100 per second while watching it.
- More events and stuff to handle in the shift. Fights with bouncer? People that don't behave in private dances (opportunity for more lewd content)?
- More information on what the club upgrades actually does.
- Why have a ton of chairs, tables, stools and bar space, when the club will never have more than 15 customers at the same time?
- What's the effect of improving stuff like floors, walls, lighting, ... ?
- What will future level ups give you as bonus? Is there a random element here? Will some bonuses be ignored if you bought them before you got them?

At level 40 I pretty much unlocked everything I could with reasonable speed with the money/tokens you get from playing. Further playing is a very slow grind to get very little and virtually nothing changes. At level ~60 I got very let down after spending quite a few levels to get $75000 to upgrade club, and noticing no difference at all. Have not seen a single extra bartender or bouncer, all the new strippers I get access to are worse than the ones I already have, and getting beyond 5 max is getting very pricey on tokens. Not to mention trying to upgrade pornstar/legendary ones.

Think I'll put this game on hold for now..

Left 4 Dead 2 is chaotic compared to even its predecessor, and while the novelty shock value of the gameâ€™s premise has worn off since Left 4 Dead 1, the new zombies and crescendo events definitely make up for it, bringing a whole new brand of panic to the experience.
   It's better than the first game, then. The biggest achievement, however, is that Valve - who are known to take their time - have managed to put such an enormous wealth of content out.
 Left 4 Dead 2 doesn't just add a few new levels and features, it fiddles and increments a formula that few thought needed changing in the first place. The team have managed to infuse their sequel with the exact same kind of nuanced creative energies that usually takes them years, and in doing so they've made last year's accomplished Left 4 Dead look like a simple mod in comparison.

Left 4 Dead 2 is quite something else. I am blown away by how simple a game can seem on the outside but be so greatly complex and well crafted that its repetitive gameplay loop can feel so addictive. The combination of the atmosphere, characters, dialogue, the story told through basic text and small chatter between the cast, the infected, music and map design really create an experience that cannot be replicated. There is a reason why Back 4 Blood never really took off late last year. You just can't match what Valve and Turtle Rock Studios did all those years ago. in addition, the Game Director was so ahead of its time for the amount of variety and outcomes that produce off its reaction to the current campaign. I truly believe that the game director really is why I can come home after work and still enjoy Left For Dead 2 playing the same campaigns a decade later.

Vintage chocolate chip cookies

Ingredients
150g salted butter, softened
80g light brown muscovado sugar
80g granulated sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 large egg
225g plain flour
Â½ tsp bicarbonate of soda
Â¼ tsp salt
200g plain chocolate chips or chunks
Method
STEP 1
Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper.

STEP 2
Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy.

STEP 3
Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg.

STEP 4
Sift 225g plain flour, Â½ tsp bicarbonate of soda and Â¼ tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon.

STEP 5
Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well.

STEP 6
Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies.

STEP 7
Bake for 8â€“10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them.

STEP 8
Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack.

RECIPE TIPS
FREEZING THE BISCUITS
If youâ€™ve frozen the biscuits, take them out and arrange them on a lined baking sheet. Once defrosted, pop them in a medium oven 190C/170 fan/gas mark 5 and heat for 2-3 mins to crisp up. Donâ€™t leave them too long or theyâ€™ll dry out.
STORING DOUGH
You can keep the uncooked dough in a sealed container in the fridge for up to two weeks. Simply take some out, dollop on a lined baking tray and allow to come up to room temperature for 5 mins before baking

This is a absolutely amazing game, i have wanted to play it for exactly 5 years and its been a while since i first got the game, i fell in love with it:) i would definitely recommend this game to other steam users.

Good with friends, mediocre at best without them.  
This game's innovative, (adaptive difficulty, physics, teamwork, etc.) but those are just the details.  The main core of the game is still just shootin' zombies and occasionally being the zombie.

Extremely fun! The main campaign feels a little short but its very re-playable, and this game includes the campaign from the first one so it feels more worth your money. Not to mention the modding community, which adds an entirely new element to an already great experience.

tl;dr If you can't decide between l4d1 and l4d2, get this one. It's got all the stuff from the first and more.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

ğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§ŸğŸ§Ÿ
[h1] Definitely a game you should have in your collection [/h1]

Left 4 Dead is a very old franchise. Left 4 Dead 2 in particular is one of the valve's best thing happened. A 14 year old game still has the calibre to bring your pals together over a co-op match and have a blast. Scream, laugh, swear, shoot and lastly whack the zombies. However playing with random players online might give you a blunt experience, because people dont usually talk much at least in L4D2. So it's best played with your friends, buddies, pals, girlfriend(s). . . . maybe ex(s) be the zombie and whack em? Sounds fun eh!

As per story line, it has a very decent setup from L4D to L4D2 with good continuation. Once its completed [b]Zoey, Bill, Francis, Louis[/b] ||  [b]Ellis, Coach, Rochelle, Nick[/b] these names will be stuck in you. You will definitely miss the moments, you can play it over and over. But you know you can't really unplay it to play again like fresh memory.

Lastly this game received an updated on 24th September 2020 named "[b]The Last Stand[/b]" which features the L4D survivors, pretty great to play it again with your friends in co-op. 

Lot of modes and mods are available on workshop, I believe that's the thing hauling the game's player-base till date. At some point you wanna invite your friends over on co-op again in the name of survivors but behind you wanna quickly switch to infected and surprise attack, and the look your friends will give over it will be worth enjoying and lot of ear cancer over the discord that's understandable. 

I would say its: [b] 9/10 OVERALL [/b]

I got nothing to complain but this game is too good, but I'll give you a cheesecake recipe.
There will be 2 parts of ingredients, one is for meringue and other one is for the cake batter

For meringue, you will need:
-5 egg whites
-1/4 tsp cream of tartar (or vinegar or lemon juice) 
-1/4 cup (50g) fine (granulated) sugar (Not Confectioner sugar)

And for the cake batter, you will need:
-5 egg yolks
-8 oz cream cheese (1 bar) 
-1/4 cup (55g) butter 
-1/2 cup (125ml) milk 
-1/4 cup (50g) fine (granulated) sugar 
-2 tbsp (15g) corn starch (magic ingredient) 
-1/4 cup (34g) flour

**note that you can add additional toppings like strawberries, confectioner sugar, fruits of your choice, honey, matcha powder, etc...

So, the preparations, there will quite long but the reward is the best.
Separate 5 beautiful eggs. Place the egg yolks in a bowl, and the egg whites in a mixer bowl.

1. Firstly you will need to place the butter, cream cheese and 1/4 cup of fine sugar into a pot over low-heat. Allow the ingredients to melt, and mix together into a beautifully smooth batter mixture.

2. Remove the pot from heat, and add the egg yolks into the batter mixture. Mix well, but gently.

3. Add the cornstarch and flour. Once again, mix well. Clumps should disappear.

4. Add milk and optionally vanilla extract or other flavors of your choice.

5. Mix well. The batter should be smooth and liquid-y. You wonâ€™t have to strain this mixture. (See video)

6. Set aside the batter as you beat the egg whites into stiff peaks (see below for egg beating tips.)

7. Pre-heat oven to 330F (or about 165C-170C). Prepare a bain-marie by putting water in a deep rectangular baking pan or dish. Place into the oven.

8. Prepare baking pansâ€” with these ingredients, you can bake one 8-inch cake or two 6-inch cakes. Line the bottoms of the baking pans with circular parchment paper, and the inside sides with rectangular strips of parchment paper. (Not wax paper.)

9. Once you achieve stiff peaks, place some beaten egg white into the batter and mix together.

10. Repeat the above step (step 9) two more times.

11. You donâ€™t want to over mix the batter. Pour the batter into the rest of the egg whites and mix together using folding techniques. You donâ€™t want to over-mix or under mix. If you over-mix, the cake will not rise. If you under-mix, your cake will be uneven. The egg white will float to the top and youâ€™ll have a meringue-like cake at the top, and a dense cheesecake at the bottom.

12. Pour the well-incorporated, but not over-mixed batter into the baking pan(s).

13. Bake bain-marie style for 25 minutes 330F (Depending on your oven, you may have to adjust the temperature.) If your cake is not rising, your oven temperature is too low. Raise by 10 degrees.

14. After 25 minutes, your cake should rise. If it has not risen yet, allow it to stay at the same temperature and give it time to rise (or you may have to raise the temperature). Once it rises nicely, crack open the oven door slightly and keep it open for 10 seconds (approximately). Lower the oven temperature to about 245-265F, depending on your oven, and bake for an additional 45 minutes. At this point, there is a possibility your cake may crack if the oven temperature is too high.

15. Allow your cake to rest in the oven after baking for about 10 minutes.

16. Remove from the oven. Be careful and use oven mitts as needed.

17. Place a sheet of parchment paper over the cake. Place a plate over the cake and parchment paper. Flip the cake upside down so the top of it is now the bottom while resting on the parchment paper over the plate. Remove the cake from the pan by sliding it out, or gently shaking it out.

And there you have it, a fine delicious cheesecake at the plate for you to eat, or throw it to your cat or at the jockeys. Feel free to decorate it with anything you like (I put hand grenade as the toppings)

Left For Dead 2: The Perfect Sequel

 After the success of Left For Dead, L4D2 follows that perfectly. Just by purchasing it, you gain access to all campaigns from its predecessor, plus additional content through different game-modes such as Versus, Survival and Scavenge. The campaign is one of the best zombie experiences out there and hasn't been replicated anywhere else...
 The core gameplay is synergy, working as a team to get from point A to point B, and while it sounds simple and ultimately is, the gameplay is perfectly replayable. Never has killing zombies been so euphoric, and games such as World War Z and Back 4 Blood fail to keep that same gruesome killing experience.
 Overall, this game is way too good to ignore. If it's on sale, it's a must-have. 10/10.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories. h

Im going start off by saying this is one of the best co-op games i have ever played.

All of the campains are linear yet have a lot to explore, there are always nooks and crannies worth checking because you might find something useful.

The Ai for all of the enemies is great to, it actually feels like a zombie apocalypse. and on the topic of enemies, each of them are very distinct from each other from their design to their mechanics.

And we all know about the Iconic core cast of Elis, Nick, Coach, and I guess Rochelle, shes definatly the most forgetable but still an interesting character.

I like the item assortment too, pretty much all weapons are viable its just about how you feel like playing or what you want to use.

And now with all of the L4D 1 campaigns I think this game has almost doubled in worth. If you want to experience L4D how it was intended go ahead and buy that seperately.But if you dont care about that and just want to play the maps with the updated L4D2 mechanics this is the best way to do it as it comes with the game.

other than just some minor problems like it feeling a bit repetative over time I'd give this game a solid 8/10

Got this game for free in 2013 for Christmas, and it still remains as the best gift that Steam has ever given me.

Left 4 Dead 2 is one of the best multiplayer based shooters/survival games of all time, every gun and weapon feels fantastic to use, each item serves as a lifeline for different situations, and the skill ceiling is so high that I have 100+ hours and I still have mechanics I haven't learned yet. When it comes to replayability, L4D2 easily lands in my top two. No matter how many times I load up the same maps, I never get tired of them. The RNG system is not only extremely well balanced, but also makes it so even when you are playing the same map it is still a different experience every time.

This is also not including the ENDLESS amount of mods that have been developed and released on the workshop, leaving ample opportunity to tailor your own personal experience.

This game has been out for ages, I don't need to sing it's praises all that much but I would be a fool not to at least leave a review after receiving this masterpiece for free!

TLDR; one of the best multiplayer based shooters to ever grace the planet and i like da funny mods

I am a 44 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 12 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

It's Left 4 Dead 2, you probably already own it, it's like two bucks whenever there's a sale.

All time classic of the horde shooter genre. Pretty much the definitive example of it to the point that here we are 13 years later and games are still "left 4 dead but...". Is it deserving of this status?

Yes. Yes it is. It's an impeccably balanced game with a broad amount of content. Every element of it just clicks into place perfectly, the special infected all have different niches that work together in ways that are never "There was nothing I could do" levels of unfair like some of the other examples of the genre. There's no mechanical bloat, there's no classes, just  "Get from point A to point B as a team" and sometimes that's all you need. The narrow focus is a strength in this case because it never gets in its own way. There's no meta player build requirement because you're playing four fundamentally identical goofs.

It's just a well put together way to murder zombies for a few hours with friends or randoms. But probably not bots because that's just a bad time.

A timeless, enduring classic that Valve was generous to give me for absolute free one Christmas. It is hands down the best co op zombie shooter that ever was or ever will be in my opinion, and the fact that it still has such a large community after all these years is a testament to that. Both casts of L4D1 and 2 are so well written and have so many interactions that even almost 100 hours in, I still hear new dialogue and reactions everytime I replay a campaign. Once again, a masterpiece that delivers on every level.

I find the guns to be too loud, I get that its kinda realism, but its a video game about zombies, and games like csgo have alot better equalization, Even some of the silenced guns aren't much more quiet than the others. There should be an easier way to change the gun volume or at very least the dynamic range so its easier to hear other sounds at a realistic level without hurting your ears after playing for awhile. This obviously does depend on how much dynamic range your headphones naturally have, but that makes the option even more important. You shouldn't need to be an audio nerd to not go deaf using certain headphones. I can't imagine how much it would hurt to play this game using the m50x with no sound filters.

This game is THE BEST zombie shooter, others might have more advanced mechanics or better graphics, however this game has charm, Complexity and Clarity. Other games might have you do Stupid puzzles that take either a brain dead amount of thought, or are crazy hard and almost force you to look up a guide. 

The only puzzle in this game is how to deal with the eldritch abominations that are the infected. you can learn to melee a hunter right out of the air as it pounces you, or listen for the coughing of the smoker and find where hes hiding. Learn how to kill a witch without it going crazy at you.

the characters are charming too, coach is a one man cheese burger Apocalypse, nick is the jackass rich guy, Ellis is a redneck mechanic who calls helicopters "whirly birds". Rochelle is the Kind hearted reporter who knows all about the infected. then there is the returning cast of left for dead 1 characters, Bill the Vietnam veteran with an attitude, Francis the biker who thinks the zombies are vampires, Louis who is cowardly yet optimistic. and finally Zoey She is supportive and friendly to her fellow survivors.

Left for dead 2 comes with brand new levels! make your way down a hotel, and through a mall. run through a sugar mill to get some gas and while you head back it starts flooding!, exciting settings such as new orleans make an appearance. and you still get to play the original left for dead's levels! and now even the old levels have brand new melee weapons witch replace your pistols and are very risky yet effective!

Overall i recomend this game to any fan of shooters or zombies! its Great experience no matter what!
Excellent game with tons of replayability. Regardless of group size, Left 4 Dead 2 stays just as fun everytime

Of all the games I've played over the years this game continues to be one I come back to play regularly, it has almost, if not, infinite replay value and is tons and tons of fun with friends. Ever since I first played this game on the 360 with a friend I was in love with this game. The gore, the guns, the zombies, it's just so simple. Like getting to point A to point B could be repetitive but that is shadowed over by the intents, face-paced action and the dialog of the interactions with survivors is just funny to listen too. Even though it is fun to play solo this game is best played with friends. How ever you play this game it is still a number 1 for me. Also it kills the time as well so yeah, pretty convinet. Also the mods for this game are great and also can be a bit...weird but let's face it we need a little bit of weird in our lives...And zombie slaying fun...And a cheeseburger apocalypse...And the one time Keith and Ellie posted a review for a game on this site called steam...Wait a minute...

In all seriousness this is a game I highly recommned for anyone to play.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.
Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

After 174 hours of gameplay, i still find extremely well made maps, weapon skins and other add-ons for this game that makes it interesting and fun to play all over again. while it always boils down to "shoot infected, carry gas from point A to B" and "try to outrun a horde of infected and your ever decreasing healthbar", there are always twists that keep this game alive and worth playing. truly unique and a masterpiece done right.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

This game saved my life.

I am 38.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.
Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

I love this video game. Ever since its first release on November 17th, 2009 I would play this game nonstop on my xbox 360, then when I finally got an xbox one I played Left 4 Dead 2 on that until I got my PC. Where I play this game to my heart's content. It has all the joys in the world packed into one soon to be 17 year old game. Its been 17 years and there has literally been no better game than Left 4 Dead 2. I remember on February 20th, 2014 I lost my copy of Left 2 Dead 2 and I cried for 7 hours, 32 minutes and 05 seconds until I cried so hard I threw up all over my what was then carpeted floor. only to find it in my kitchen after I threw up. My divorces, eviction threats, and 3 jobs firing me mean nothing to me when I have my Left 4 Dead 2 <3. I love you Left 4 Dead 2. I love you.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Bakit ko ba nire-recommend sa'yo 'to? Maganda? Oo, maganda. Pero alam mo kung ano'ng mas maganda? 'Yon ay ang maging isang ganap na Mentally Stable person na nagagawa ang gusto nang walang halong doubt at mayroong self confidence. Pero bakit ko nga ba ito sinasabi? Wala lang. Pero ang importante, may sinabi ako. 'Yan lang ang mahalaga. Nasa sa'yo na kung bibilhin mo ito o hindi. Magtiwala ka lang sa iyong sarili. Alam ko na kaya mo at ako ang pinaka-unang tao na magiging proud sa'yo. Sana'y maging ayos ka sa pang araw araw. You matter and everything you've done is worth it.

This game is still active with players after nearly 15 years, though be careful of what lobby you join or game server you get into. You'll always want Official Dedicated servers when in multiplayer modes to avoid extra nonsense, and do be warned, players can upload any image or gif they want and make it a spray in the game. You will see all kinds of things that you either never seen before, never want to see again, or actively search on a daily basis. If you're playing the game to focus on the game, you won't really notice any of the extra distractions.
