Old Fashioned Pumpkin Pie

2 large eggs
1 large egg yolk
1/2 cup packed dark brown sugar
1/3 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1/8 teaspoon cardamom
1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest
2 cups pumpkin purÃ©e from a sugar pumpkin (see Recipe Note) OR 1 (15-ounce can) pumpkin purÃ©e (can also use purÃ©ed cooked butternut squash)
1 1/2 cups heavy cream or 1 (12-ounce) can evaporated milk
1 homemade pie crust, chilled or frozen (see pÃ¢te brisÃ©e recipe or our no-fail flaky pie crust recipe), or 2 pre-made pie shells

Preheat the oven:
Preheat your oven to 425Â°F.
Make the filling:
Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Mix in the brown sugar, white sugar, salt, spices â€” cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, ground cloves, cardamom, and lemon zest.
Mix in the pumpkin purÃ©e. Stir in the cream. Beat together until everything is well mixed.
mixing pumpkin pie ingredients
pumpkin pie ingredients mixed well
adding cream to pumpkin pie puree
pumpkin pie filling ready to add to pie
Fill the pie shell and bake:
Pour the filling into an uncooked chilled or frozen pie shell. Bake at a high temperature of 425Â°F for 15 minutes.
Then after 15 minutes, lower the temperature to 350Â°F. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes more. The pie is done when a knife tip inserted in the center comes out wet but relatively clean. The center should be just barely jiggly.
(About half-way through the baking, you may want to put foil around the edges or use a pie protector to keep the crust from getting too browned.)
Note that the pumpkin pie will come out of the oven all puffed up (from the leavening of the eggs), and will deflate as it cools.
pumpkin pie in dish ready for baking
Baked Pumpkin Pie From Scratch
Cool the pie on a rack, then serve:
Cool the pumpkin pie on a wire rack for 2 hours.
Serve with whipped cream.

One of the best games of all time.

The story and humor are exceptional, and the design is very fitting for a post apocalyptic world.

The enemies, called the infected, present a variety of challenge to the game. They come in three types, the normal Infected, the Uncommon Infected (whom are extra dangerous due to the equipment they had before being turned), and the Tremendously dangerous Special Infected, who have mutated special ways to kill you, be it a frog-like tongue, or jumping out at you from the shadows. 

The campaigns are fun to play, and the different modes, difficulties, and challenges give it almost infinite replayability. That's not to mention the extremely dedicated and hard working community creating new campaigns to play through. (A few of my personal favorites are Redemption 2, Back to School, Day Break, Urban Flight, Suicide Blitz 2, and Riptide.)

If campaigns not your style, why not try a mutation? These fun game modes change how the game works by implementing different rules, such as Last Man On Earth, in which you are alone, and only the Special Infected spawn. How about Four Swordsmen? Just you, your teammates and 4 Katanas between you and the horde.

If you're feeling a bit competitive, why not play some Versus? This game mode pits a 4-person Survivor team against a 4-person Infected Team, rotating every round. The Survivors goal is to make it through the level without being killed, and the Infected's goal is to kill the survivors as soon as possible.

The fun never ends in this zombie-shooting, post-apocalyptic, humorous first person shooter.

There's also a gnome.

This game has had a significant impact on my life, more than Iâ€™d care to admit.

First and only online multiplayer game Iâ€™ve ever played [was bit of a shy gurl worried about how pros would react to my poor skills]. Started playing it online cos my friends were not always around. I really liked the game, so was sort-of forced to venture into the world of MMOFPS, and boy! what a world it is.

It seems to me [and I am really not experienced in these types of games, so could be wrong] that this game, unlike any other, allows a remarkable degree of freedom to play around with code and create your own custom game, which a lot of people with coding skills actually do. The result is that now there are some fascinating modded servers with all kinds of tweaks that make the playing experience unique and really fun. When you land on those servers as a noob, it can be tough. But if you endure the teasing and occasional kick from the game, you get to experience something quite beautiful.

No microtransactions, no pay-to-win horseshit, you rely on your aiming skills and the energy you give off in chat to win the game and to win new friends. The community is, true, highly competitive and medium-high toxic. But once you clear out the garbage, you find some nice and truly smart people. Just like in any other area of life. Iâ€™m writing this [my first] highly subjective review free of technicalities at 3 AM after a wonderful session with some very smart Earthlings, something I would never experience if this game was never made.

L4D2 got me through some tough periods when I was on autopilot battling depression and it gave me something to occupy my mind and practice reaction time. Because itâ€™s simple, but at the same time remarkably complicated. Maybe thatâ€™s why it so dear to my heart. Thank you, Gaben and Valve, thank you for Half-Life, and Portal, as well as this gem of a game. Youâ€™ve changed my life.

I spend majority of my time playing the Tankrun mutation because no one complains if you stray away from the team and its basically the best overall mode to bunnyhop in. Solo skips aren't that frowned upon as the team only cares about making it to the end. Learning how to dodge several tanks by baiting, having it climb, stalling in certain areas so your team can progress, rock juking in the tightest spaces or out running a tank by bhopping is always a thrill especially on expert where 1 hit = a down. Some maps are BS but possible like The Passing when you don't have an adren drop for the under water tour because the director didn't spawn one, The Sacrifice chapter 1's Tank door unable to be opened even on easy because a tank respawns and wont ever be able to be interacted with it, The Parish Chapter 2 panic event if you have slow as fuck teamates/bots, No Mercy hospital chapter where you are required to exploit on expert and other examples you will see commonly if you play the mode with the small existing community for the mode. Mainly the problems you would face are tank spawns and its reach in high ping scenarios

I do not touch VS mode because online rando is almost always competitive and non friendly to newer players.
Make a mistake? You get kicked.

Don't know how to play as the infected team? 
You get kicked.

Your teammates don't hear you getting pounced, hung, etc by a special infected and you die from their incompetency? 
You get kicked.

You don't do anything wrong and are actually a good teammate?
You get kicked.

No incentive to play VS even with almost 800hrs at the time of writing.

I would recommend Tankrun for people who enjoy going fast and don't mind exploits and skips with a huge side of BS. 

Avoid VS unless you already have experience or have enough friends to play non competitive (FOR THE LOVE OF GOD DON'T KICK PEOPLE WHO HAVE DONE NOTHING WRONG BECAUSE YOU FORGOT TO MAKE THE LOBBY FRIENDS ONLY), 

Survival in my minimal experience Is pretty lame as its just running in circles while trying not to get incapacitated which is similar to cod zombies in a way with less to do

Scavenge mode I never touched as its also a VS exclusive mode

Realism is for those who think expert is too easy and want an actual punishment for death and non cooperation

Thats about it.

The good:  Fun game play, lots of replay value (especially with friends)
Classic game that helped establish Valve as top-tier game studio.   Brings Zombie survival to multiplayer.  Very unique mechanics for asymmetric shooter.
The action is fast-paced but the game is simple so it's easy to learn/come back to.  The levels have parts that are randomized by the computer so replaying it doesn't get boring.  Trash talking your friends and the crazy things that can randomly interfere with who wins make the game really funny.

The bad:  Match-making with strangers and toxic community.

Parts of the game can be hard to pick up.  For example, as infected you have to attack together and it's often the case that one person has to sacrifice themselves by going first so that the other infected can follow-up but people either don't know this or don't want to do it because they don't trust the strangers they're playing with.

It's hard to find good match making as everyone these days seems to want to find someone to carry them and so they vote-kick all the new players, many of whom are legitimately trying and just don't know what to do.   Long ago, somebody on your team solo-carried all the bad players and didn't care.  Now average players are flaming constantly and vote-kicking noobs just to get a better team that can carry them.  Nobody switches teams to even teams out.

Because infected requires coordination it's easy to get destroyed by pre-mades if you're rolling by yourself with randos.  If your teammates refuse to spawn as infected or you get incapped immediately by zombies as survivors then it feels like you're not reallly playing the game.

The game is not competitive and doesn't have a ranking system so why are you trying to win?  Nobody's keeping score.   Lots of people seem to be modding servers / running hacks to give themselves an edge also.

So basically it has the toxic mentality of league or some other competitive team-based game with no ranking system to reward you for overcoming the toxicity.

If you can find a community to play with or make a friends list then it's really a fun game still.  I guess it's getting a little old after 10 years.

So basically great with friends, kinda trash by yourself but it's a cheap game and you can make friends on line pretty easily as a lot of people want to make friends to avoid these issues.
Left 4 Dead 2. My dad came back right as I downloaded the game.

You know, I went back and forth about recommending this to others. The game is excellent, and the community  has lasted forever, but something rubs me wrong about the number of women that play this game combined with the reasons most of play this game, the thrill of leaving your team behind. For years I have pondered the mystery as to why women gravitate towards this game, and I don't really have an answer. My recommendation is purely to further the research into the science behind this mystery, where it leads us as a species I leave to you to discover.

Also, play on Rampage or Zombie Islands (10v10), but fair warning if you have not done much versus these servers are quite demanding. 20 years later though, its just what the doctor ordered, nice and relaxing and still with that thrill of survival at every turn. I am unable to think of any other game that generates the laughs per second that this one does, and to this day the deep level of investment in game design and art remain impressive, what it must have been like to work on such a focused game with such a limited budget as far as computer power goes.

I vow if I ever purchase Steam, I will make a modern Left 4 Dead ;)

If you can't tell, this is the classic zombie game of all zombie games. The remake, Back 4 Blood is an embarrassment to what these games stood for. One of the first outstanding looks at motion capture, the best procedural AI for zombies as they chase after you in hordes, and the general fun you get playing with friends. The beauty of the game comes from the sheer effort put into it all those years ago, and it standing up to this day. Games these days are rushed and rated Triple A (AAA) top of the line industry-rated video-games that use technology that proves to be more of a challenge to enjoy the game, simply because they had to cut corners constantly and satisfy the people in charge. The corporate market for the gaming industry has plagued our fun with glitches, bugs, copy-paste game design, and now the term "Game Engine" has shifted meaning from a complex system to run the game on, providing it with a software to make the game run and look amazing, to a buggy mess that gives the player lack of immersion because they didn't bother to work out the kinks of the physics engine or textures. I'm looking at you Ubisoft. The beauty of game design is in the hallowed halls of Valve. Where they have redefined gaming for almost every one of the titles they release. I cannot tell you the amount of nostalgia I obtain simply from playing this game in it's base form. No workshop mods, nothing. The hours I would spend alone, fighting with random people I met online or with my brothers as I trudged through horde after horde of monsters that LITERALLY FEEL LIKE THEY WANT TO KILL YOU. The horror genre was forever redefined. No, the Zombie genre was redefined after all these games started biting off of the premises introduced by the first game. Needless to say, in conclusion I have found that through all the times I have played on a PC for the sake of chilling with friends, one of the first games I still recommend is Left 4 Dead 2. A pinnacle of the gaming industry.

Left 4 Dead 2 or as I like to call it: Left 4 Cope, is a fun zombie shooting game where your objective is to get as far away as possible from your friends. Common misconception is that you're supposed to work together with teammates, however this is false as you should be able to survive without teammates on expert.

 In versus gamemode your objective is not to win, but to rather to make your opponents cope as much as possible. Easiest possible way to achieve this, is by playing the game well and knowing the ins and outs of this game and exploiting the broken spawn system.

Recommend? Absolutely.

Comment:
Even if this game is 13 years old it still has really good graphics. The gameplay is a story where you need to complete a bunch of "waves", you gonna need to kill the zombies that are around the map until you reach the safe zone, you gotta do this over and over again until the end of the story. At first, it may be fun doing these, but after a little bit, it gets really boring cause you always do the same thing over and over, kill zombies, reach the safe zone, kill zombies, reach the safe zone. The multiplayer is kinda dead, there's almost no one playing on the multiplayer. But this game can run on any low-end system, of course with low settings, and it can get to 60 fps stable. I would recommend buying this in the bundle of the Game Of The Year edition cause it cost half of the price combined with 2 games.

A fun fact for potential players, a med-kit will heal you. a standard med-kit contains plasters in a variety of different sizes and shapes. small, medium and large sterile gauze dressings. at least 2 sterile eye dressings. triangular bandages.

Pain pills will also heal you, but only temporarily. Adrenaline is also temporary; Adrenaline triggers the body's fight-or-flight response. This reaction causes air passages to dilate to provide the muscles with the oxygen they need to either fight danger or flee. this makes you run faster,  perform actions faster and be an unstoppable force against zombies.

First of all, compare this to COD zombies.
Personally I regret money spent on COD instead of the best zombie game in the world: L4D2.

AI teamates are also very good. They do not have too much aimbot, nor do they health cheat. Or maybe they do, I never really see them heal. So I just heal them.

I really enjoy this game. Sometime it can be difficult, but hey keep on trying! It's super awesome, I also highly recommend this game to anyone who likes zombie first person shooter games. Make sure you have 3 friends (or more) to play this with cause the A.I's in the game are totally retarded! When you get injured, and are down to the ground using your pistols on the zombies, the A.I's will not help you, and it's so frustrating. I mean I can understand they're trying to kill the zombies but still. Usually this game goes on sell for 1$, or so. I got it on sell, cause like that's a pretty good price. Soo, yeah. That's what I gotta review about left 4 dead 2. Super crazy game, but it brings back memories of playing this on my xbox 360 with my brother, or usually by myself.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Been playing this game since it first released on the 360. Hands down one of the best pick-up-and-play zombie shooters out on the market.  Between my xbox time and my time here on steam, I absolutely adore this game. The modding capabilities are endless and having access to hundreds of community made maps also just adds to the replayability of this gem. 

With mods you can update the graphics and shading to be more modern/HD and it performs well with low-high end PCs as long as you know what settings you're working with. For lower end PCs I highly recommend going easy on the workshop stuff because it will bog you down, for higher end peeps, go crazy and have fun. Let loose and mow down zombies as you work with your team to safety and survival! 

The community from what I've experienced is mostly wholesome, though I have come across some rather toxic players as well; but, that's the internet for you. You take the good with the bad, y'know? Seriously though, worth the purchase, still an amazing game that holds up even among the newer generation of games  released.
i liked the story to the game.

Left For Dead holds up in 2022, due to it's massive modding community! I play it more than BFB I'd say. This game is practical and timeless. Without the modding community it would have been lost to time.

I used to have this game and didn't think much of it at the time.

Now I play this game so much. It's insanely arcadey and is one of the few games that is hard to find just like it. I feel like most similar games lack it's arcadey feel. It's so fun to go back in and mess with friends to kill so many zombies over and over again. The game just doesn't get old, it's fun to jump right back into it again and just mess around.

The 4 survivors are all great and enjoyable, Nick's a sarcastic jerk who lightens up as things goes on, Coach takes charge and is fun mess, Ellis is hilarious, and Rochelle is a witty badass. This even includes the original survivors and they're also so good.

Oh and I didn't even get into MODS. You can either turn it into a meme mess, a unique fun take, a dumb crossover fanfic, or just flat out enhance the game with vanilla mods. One of the things I do, vanilla wise that is, is make everything winter during the winter season to make everything feel colder. 

Custom campaigns are also another way to enhance the game. I recommend looking through them and the community to find the best ones, people make lots of creative and vanilla feeling campaigns.

Overall, heavily recommend. It often goes on sale for the cheap, comes with L4D1, and this game is so fun.
bruh this game is pretty good, nice gore effects, good sound effects, funny lines, and easy modding (if you are interested)

This game saved my life.

I am 69.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

Awesome game!

There is nothing more satisfying than getting into the rescue vehicle on expert difficulty, knowing that you got there purely by you and your team's evolution of skill in combat, strategies and experience. No bullsh*t  ranking system that needs grinding to get an edge on the AI. PURE SKILL. The AI is also intuitive with convincing navigation and appealing characteristics of the infected (tracking, gore, idle animations, physics based shoves etc.). AND THE MODS AND MAPS ON THE WORKSHOP JUST MAKE THIS SOO MUCH MORE FUN AND ENGAGING. DON'T PLAY L4D2, IF YOU'RE NOT GOING TO EXPERIMENT A LITTLE. Not only are there some spectacular crowd sourced campaigns i.e. YAMA, Red Tide, Discrapper etc. But also an abundance of models, textures, sounds etc. that bring soo many laughs to any campaign.

Highly recommend

The game itself is pretty good, the price is fine and items in TF2 are great.
Can be difficult sometimes, but it'll get easier the more you play it. Yet it can be impossible without losing one of the characters. (SPOILER: The Sacrifice, The Last Stand [Tank on top of the house].)
I like the design of campaigns, and the finales of them. Those are basically just survival.
Difficulties can be at some parts of campaigns where you need to rush through GIANTS HORDES OF ZOMBIES. You can be confused "Where do i go now?", me too, since usually there's no navigation. I also liked the mechanics of some zombies, like the Clown or the Witch.
Price says for itself, not the best, but not the worst. I recommend the game, 8.6/10

The Hog Rider card is unlocked from the Spell Valley (Arena 5). He is a very fast building-targeting, melee troop with moderately high hitpoints and damage. He appears just like his Clash of Clans counterpart; a man with brown eyebrows, a beard, a mohawk, and a golden body piercing in his left ear who is riding a hog. A Hog Rider card costs 4 Elixir to deploy.

Strategy

His fast move speed can boost forward mini tanks like an Ice Golem in a push. At the same time, he can also function as a tank for lower hitpoint troops such as Goblins as he still has a fair amount of health. Most cheap swarms complement the Hog Rider well, as they are nearly as fast as him and usually force more than one card out of the opponent's hand.

The Hog Rider struggles with swarms, as they can damage him down and defeat him quickly while obstructing his path. Barbarians in particular can fully counter him without very strict timing on the defender's part, though be wary of spells.

A Hunter can kill the Hog Rider in 2 hits if placed right on top of it. However, if you place something in front of the Hog Rider, the Hunter's splash will damage the Hog Rider and hit the card in front of it more.

The Hog Rider in conjunction with the Freeze can surprise the opponent and allow the Hog Rider to deal much more damage than anticipated, especially if the opponent's go-to counter is a swarm, or swarms are their only effective counter to him. Skeletons and Bats will immediately be defeated by the spell, while Spear Goblins, Goblins, and Minions will be at low enough health to be defeated by a follow up Zap or Giant Snowball.

However, this strategy isn't very effective against buildings as the Hog Rider will take a while to destroy the building, giving the opponent ample time to articulate another counter.

Against non-swarm troops, it can deal a lot of damage during the freeze time, but this can allow the opponent to set up a massive counterpush. For this reason, players should either only go for a Hog Rider + Freeze when they have other units backing it up from a counterattack, or if the match is about to end and they need to deal as much damage as possible.

It is not a good idea to send in a Hog Rider simply to destroy a building, especially if it is the only building targeting unit available, as defeating Crown Towers becomes substantially more difficult. Spells or simply waiting out the lifetime of the building are more effective. The exception to this is an Elixir Collector placed in front of the King's Tower. If a Hog Rider placed at the bridge, he can destroy the Collector for a positive Elixir trade, though the damage from both Princess Towers will usually mean he does not survive to deal any damage to them. However, if the opponent sends in defending troops, it can be an opportunity to gain spell damage value.

In a deck with several low-cost cards, it might be worth it to simply send the Hog Rider against one building. These decks shuffle their card rotation quick enough, that they will arrive to their next Hog Rider before the next building arrives in the opponent's card rotation.

Long-ranged troops like Musketeer and Flying Machine can snipe those buildings, preserving some of the Hog Rider's health, possibly allowing it to get some Tower damage.

When there are buildings placed in the middle to counter the Hog Rider, understanding the placement of the Hog Rider and the type of building placed can help the Hog Rider to bypass certain buildings.

Passive buildings such as spawners and Elixir Collector have a larger hitbox than defensive buildings; which means that if a passive building was placed 3 tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, then it is impossible for the Hog Rider to bypass that placement as the Hog Rider will get pulled to that building.

Defensive buildings have a smaller hitbox than a passive building, which means if that if a defensive building was placed three tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, a Hog Rider placed at the very left or right side of the Arena may be able to bypass it due to its smaller hitbox.

If the player has a building already placed down in the center of the arena, and the opponent tries to bypass it with a Hog Rider at the edge of the arena, they can use certain air troops to push the Hog Rider towards the building as it jumps over the river, effectively denying the bypass attempt. They must be already hovering over the correct placement, as very quick reflexes are required to correctly perform this technique.

For Bats, Skeleton Dragons, and Minion Horde, they should be placed right in front of the Hog Rider as soon as it is deployed.

For Minions, Skeleton Barrel, Mega Minion, Flying Machine, Electro Dragon, Baby Dragon, Inferno Dragon, Balloon, and Lava Hound, stagger the above placement one tile to the right if the Hog Rider is placed on the left side of the arena, and vice versa.

They can also use ground troops to achieve the same result. Something like an Ice Golem deployed at the Hog Riderâ€™s landing spot will obstruct his path and force him to go around the unit, which causes him to be closer to the building instead of the Crown Tower.

The Hog Rider can kite Very Fast non-building targeting troops due to his own Very Fast speed and building only targeting if he is placed on the fourth tile from the bridge, slightly into the opposite lane. He can also stall grounded units when placed right at the bridge. He will pull them towards him while deploying, and then be untargetable by them when he jumps over the bridge. After landing, he will pull them back. This can be useful when the player needs to deal damage in the same lane they are defending. It will also help separate troops behind a tank in a large push.

A Tornado placed on the second tile front of the player's King's Tower and staggered two tiles towards the Princess Tower will activate it without any damage dealt to the Princess Tower, helping them in defending future pushes. This can also be a method of mitigating all damage dealt to a Princess Tower, but doing this more than three times may result in the King's Tower's health being low enough to be targeted directly, opening up the possible threat of a back door three crown. A better alternative is to pull the Hog away from the Princess Tower into the attacking range of all three Crown Towers, which will negate all damage as long as none of them are already distracted

A very powerful combo is the Hog Rider, the Musketeer, and the Valkyrie, typically referred to as the Trifecta. The Musketeer will defend against most troops, while the Valkyrie can protect her and the Hog Rider from swarms or high damage units. The Hog Rider is used to deal damage to the tower.

This can be effectively countered by Lightning, one-shotting the Musketeer and severely damaging both the Valkyrie and Hog Rider. The Minion Horde is also effective, but the enemy can Zap them and the Musketeer will one-shot them all. Even if the Musketeer is defeated, the Hog Rider and Valkyrie will have enough time to severely damage the Tower.

The Hog Rider should be placed behind the Valkyrie to give it a boost so that it stays in front of the Hog Rider, protecting it.

A Hog Rider combined with a Goblin Barrel can be awkward for the opponent to defend against. Timing it so that the Hog Rider is tanking the tower shots for the Goblins is the most effective way to deal damage. However, a Barbarian Barrel can shut this down with minimal Tower damage for a positive Elixir trade, as long as the Goblin Barrel was placed directly on the Tower.

Left 4 Dead 2 is a 2009 first-person shooter game developed and published by Valve. The sequel to Turtle Rock Studios's Left 4 Dead (2008) and the second game in the Left 4 Dead series, it was released for Microsoft Windows and Xbox 360 in November 2009, Mac OS X in October 2010, and Linux in July 2013.

Left 4 Dead 2 builds upon cooperatively focused gameplay and Valve's proprietary Source engine, the same game engine used in the original Left 4 Dead. Set during the aftermath of an apocalyptic pandemic, the game focuses on four new Survivors, fighting against hordes of zombies known as the Infected, who develop severe psychosis and act extremely aggressive. The Survivors must fight their way through five campaigns, interspersed with safe houses that act as checkpoints, with the goal of escape at each campaign's finale. The gameplay is procedurally altered by the "AI Director 2.0", which monitors the players' performance and adjusts the scenario to provide a dynamic challenge. Other new features include new types of special infected and an arsenal of melee weapons.

The game made its world premiere at E3 2009 with a trailer during the Microsoft press event. Prior to release, it received mixed critical and community reactions and attracted an unusually high volume of controversy about its graphic content. In response, alterations were made to the cover art, but both Australia and Germany refused to rate the unmodified edition at the time of release. Despite this, the game was met with positive critical reviews and is considered to be one of the greatest video games ever made, much like its predecessor.

This is one of those games where it proves the statement, "Old is gold."

L4D2 is amazing. Not because the gameplay is THAT fun. IMO, its a mix of it's interesting and short story as well as the value you get playing this game with friends. 

The story is great for a zombie game in an industry where it's just the same schtick multiple times over. Even if it's just haha zombie virus go brrrr, the characters really glowed it up. Ellis, Bill, that one guy with the suit. Coach is fucking awesome. 

And the value you get with friends. When you play with people you truly are friends with, your experience gets multiplied by ten-fold. That one time where one of my friends shot a witch while taunting it, only to get obliterated. Ah... that one was good.

Overall rating: 8/10

One of the best games ever made, no hyperbole.

Shooting never gets old, flawless general game design, brilliant small design details you may not even notice, but the game would be obviously worse without, strategy changes greatly depending on which mode you play. Anyone who says it's just a mindless but fun zombie shooter has never tried playing Realism Expert (or even Advanced). At its core, it's a game about communication and coordination. Infinitely replayable.

I can't think of any other coop game that can be so fun and enjoyable, as many times as you play it. I have spent hours and hours playing with friends and losing it because of the mods we had installed or the times we mess up, or how the game is overall.

L4D2 is great, most of the characters are very likeable and have amazing personalities. The campaigns are very fun and memorable, and the gameplay, is not so complicated, but very fun, it can be very challenging sometimes tho, especially on higher difficulties, but it is always a blast to play through, plus you always end up finding little secrets you had no idea they existed along the maps.

And of course, the elephant in the room, modding is incredible. There is a lot of very good mods in the Workshop which can make the experience overall very funny, and you can change almost everything about the game as is. Plus there are campaigns made by the community, so you never really run out of content, there is always something new to do.
(There is a lot of trash on the Workshop too, like in any other Steam game that has one, but it is very easy to avoid)

Overall, very fun, especially with a party of friends. Absolutely would recommend.

I am so late to the crowd but damn I love this game! I thought I hated zombie stuff but this game is fun, for the most part.
AFter this game has been out for 12 years or whatever, I do wonder why I notice Quality of Life things right away that I wonder why weren't implemented by now.
-quick matchmaking with custom settings. If I have settings such as Difficulty set to Advanced in online play, why not make auto match making do that too? It just defaults to normal and any map, lobby or not
-Reorganizing the credits. Some people seem to disagree with me and try to say 'thats's not  the point of a co-op" but I'm going to say in any FPS I care about my kills. Why do I have to wait until the VERY BOTTOM of the long credits to see total kills, team saves, special kills.. I dont care about how long the game took, how many revives I had to do.. Show me kills first!
-which leads me to, would be nice to show me my stats at anytime when I hit TAB in game. The in-game tab is 100% useless as far as I see, just shows ping? 
-An easier way to MUTE people. There are some annoying ass people that dont turn off their mic and I shouldnt have to take a class in C++ programming to figure out what to type in console to mute somebody.

Minor QOL things but would love them. Someone said 'there's a mod for that' and yet, I didn't find any.

Other than that, fun game!

[h1] Best game ever, However... [/h1]

One of my favourite games of all time, barely anything comes close.
This game is a perfect amalgamation of everything I love, CO-OP, zombies, play as zombie, Campaigns that aren't super long and super re-playable.

The single most impressive thing about this game is the Director, it makes the game so much more interesting with it's different pathings, unique system of what comes next.

Most of the maps are very satisfying, have great settings that aren't just at night time. I'm glad they added more day time maps compared to L4D1 when it first came out.

Music is fan-f*cking-tastic

The addition of the steam mod workshop to keep this game alive after so many years was such a blessing because it keeps players..playing. It keeps me invested to see that so many creative and talented people create models based off characters I enjoy in other media. The creativity in map design from some of these mods are seriously unreal, it can be breathtaking at times. One of my favourite things about this game for sure.

However, the one or two problems I have with this game is;
[b]Community[/b]
This community has got to be the most confusing thing ever. Players can range to- incredibly fun to play with- to absolute a**holes- to some who are chill/relaxed who like to just play for fun, nothing serious- to incredibly toxic slur induced cry babies. Also, so many people have disgusting sprays it's ridiculous.

They whine if you make a mistake, kick you for making a mistake. They take versus so competitively that if you slip up even once, you're kicked no questions asked, no second chances. Have a furry pfp? Get absolutely harassed by everyone in sight, no one there to defend you. You have no right to judge anyone by what they like, if you can't even do research on them. Not all of them f*** dogs, no one judges you for your ugly army loli pfp, so leave them be. I could go on, but this is already getting super long.


[b]Versus hit detection (both sides)[/b]
The hit detection for both sides is atrocious. When you're perfectly lined up with a survivor as lets say a charger or jockey, it teleports the survivor to the side while you just go through them. It can cost you the game easily and is incredibly frustrating. (This doesn't apply specifically to Charger and jockey, it's everything, but probably not spitter.) 

When pouncing a survivor it's even worse. When you pounce someone as hunter or jockey, the survivors can push you from a mile away. However, when YOU'RE survivor, you line up the shove so perfectly you think you're going to get the stun? Short answer, no you f*cking don't. Your shove was completely worthless, which happens about 85% of the time by the way. It isn't about "getting good" because I absolutely should have gotten a stun but it didn't count. I should also mention, this happens at any ping. It happens when you have low ping but can also happen at high ping (obviously).

Sure, you can argue that this is a 18+ game, but most of my concerns is when these so called "adults" play this game like whiny cry babies, it makes the game unbearable.

[b]Overall, I would rate this game a 9/10, knocked down a point just because of the community.[/b]

Good game. Plenty of active players. Entering a lobby is quick, unlike *that other zombie game*. If you play solo, it's still plenty fun. Fun game-play types besides playing the usual storyline.

So take your friends and plunge into this world of hell zombies (more species of especially infected are waiting for you!), From which you donâ€™t want to leave before dawn. In the second part, new companies are waiting for us, which are filled with the drive of rock and the sun, and a different atmosphere in relation to the first part. But despite this, both parts turned out so well that the developers took the companies from the first part, added them to the new version of the Source Engine, where you have not only more weapons, but also more especially infected enemies, for which you You can play multiplayer battles 4 on 4.

If after many hours of the game you feel that you want more from this powerful engine and this world of the game, then to your attention is a library from the Steam Workshop, which contains 1000 different modifications from a simple weapon skin change to a large-scale changes of everything you want, and if something is not found, then maybe soon I will see your modification in the top of the best :)

R.S. The most unique case is that when the developers released the first part, and a year later they released the second, and made it not only worse than the first, but even better!

10 \ 10 adrenaline for survival until the morning!

Its been 18 hours without Roblox, I canâ€™t stop shaking and Iâ€™m having severe mental breakdowns. I couldnâ€™t go to school today, I am so worried that I even took my dads gun from the shed, thinking of killing myself. I am nothing without Roblox, it is my life, it is my destiny, without Roblox, I wouldn't be able to do anything. I found her home later then and tried to talk to her, she was so kind and cute that i accidentally typed my thoughts out "mind: she's so cute.." and she flushed then i got nervous, we then went in and made out, after that we went on many dates to Adopt Me, where we adopted 2 boys named DemonicLuciferr, and RedDoflaming0. Demonic and Red were so cute that I even took them out of town and took them to Brookhaven. after that we had our own child in Bloxburg on our rooftop named lazerlamps. Great maps, I found myself not getting misguided as nearly as much as I was in L4D1. Reviewing this many years late, but the ideas for the enemy additions were excellent as well and I donâ€™t think they could have chosen any better for a game that requires a lot running, shooting like crazy, but also team coordination and skills in special infected dispatching or evasion. Each map had really recognizable OST that sticks with me to this day. PvE and PvP are equally fun and offer a satisfying amount of things to do for those long term players who occasionally need a break from continually going from one campaign straight into another. The characters they chose to utilize were great and equally as funny as the interactions you would find in L4D1. I credit this game to a lot of fun weeks of gameplay in my childhood and it continues to be entertaining each time I play to this very day. Overall also an excellent game if youâ€™re a beginner at video games or even streaming and youâ€™re looking for material that wonâ€™t fail you or perhaps your audience. Plays better with friends but NPCs from my point of view had less issues with me than they did in L4D1.

needless to say, it's a Valve game, so polished, preformant, and highly modable (thus infinitely customizable). I would recommend this game, so long as you have people to play it with (the more the merrier).

Easily one of the best co-op games ever made with functionally infinite replay value and amazing depth to it's design. 
The fact that you can play it for 10+ years (used to play it on my brother's steam account before I got my own) and still hear new voice lines every now and then, and continually find yourself in new and unique situations, is a true testament to the craftsmanship with which Valve has made this game.

Turtle Rock may claim to be the creators of L4D but in reality they are not. Valve are the ones we have to thank and I do believe that should be very evident by now. 
Don't bother with TR's "spiritual successor", play L4D if you want the best zombie apocalypse experience with friends. Especially now with it's price being so low it's a complete steal.

Left 4 Dead 2 is a classic zombie game that's fun and full of great moments. if you haven't played left 4 dead you are absolutely missing out, its worth the money especially if you have friends who like games. the zombies look, sound, and feel authentic, (especially when they're mauling you). Coach, Ellis, Rochelle, and Nick are the four playable characters and each of them has their own personality to really help you connect with them, in my opinion this enhances the game because not only are you murdering zombies but you're also listening to the very good dialogue which improves your time playing exponentially. I love this game and I think you will too. Highly recommend.

I did try the Xbox 360 version, and while its the only way to play this game on consoles, this game can run on practically any new PC or laptop these days, so I recommend the PC version above all else. Not only do you get way better performance, you also get access to the Steam Workshop which provides you with a whole suite of mods from weapon skins, character skins down to new entire maps for you to play on which is incredible. Last night, I was playing a match with a friend and thanks to mods I had my characters dressed as Big Smoke from San Andreas; Leon's police uniform from Resident Evil 2 and another character dressed as Tony Montana from Scarface. What other game are you going to get an experience like that?

Valve titles have always been a level above the competition, but left 4 dead 2 takes the cake. The levels of polish are insane, you can get lost in the minor details and small considerations that just make the game perfectly immersive. The graphics, though from 2009, surprisingly still hold up today. Being a Valve game, the level design is incredibly intuitive and very thoughtful. The zombies are much more believable than other titles, they mope around when they have not seen you, in-fight with each other, they act diseased, they have momentum when running and moving and there are over 1000 death animations so no two deaths are ever alike.

All in all, the game is a masterpiece and definitely worth the Â£7.19. Shooting a zombie in the stomach as he runs towards you and watching his bowls spill out all over the floor whilst being able to see your team-mates through the whole you just made is still one of the coolest effects in any game I've ever played. 10/10.

Probably one of the best if not the best zombie game of all time. Every aspect of the game is perfectly crafted to an unbelievable level. The characters have unique personality and background, the level design is top tier in gameplay, story, and aesthetic design, the mechanic is simple with a high skill ceiling, every round almost never feels the same thanks to The AI Director constantly changing item spawns and the amount of infected and special infected based on your performance, the game is filled with content both in singleplayer and co-op/multiplayer, the atmosphere is a perfect blend of action, horror, and comedy, full compatibility with the workshop to give extra replayability through mod guns and custom maps, I can go on and on. The all time classic indeed

So I've seen this game here and there, and I've always thought "Meh, it's an old game, I doubt it's that fun". And honestly... I was SLEEPING on this game. I got bored and bought it now, and my goodness it's so much fun. The best horde shooter I've played yet. And plus, because it's an old game, it runs amazingly well on my friend's office pre-built PC, and we play together.

So if you're into FPSs, and looking for a fun, fast-paced wave/horde shooter, this game is absolutely worth it. And even if your friends have an old, poopy PC, you can still play together with them. And it's not that expensive as well, absolutely worth the price.

And of course, the mods. The modding community is extremely active, and all the mods are a-plenty. It can be something really cool, or something downright stupid. It's great.

Game description key-points: an outdated Co-Op game with Zombies, much better than 1st part. For free or cheap still has some powder to offer fun for your time.

Overview:
definitely was cool and good to play back in the past days, but the main downside are outdated textures.
The is also some credibility behind hearsay that it`s the best part in series, beating in some aspects 4th part.

There are two options to play it: as a Single or multi-player game.
Online with other players is really fun, beating Zombies by all means in different Levels designed to get to a safe house destination point by literally clearing the path full of zombies and some powerful hostiles.
Also other game modes, like survive or looting etc.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably deadâ€“ murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time â€“ something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange â€“ uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" â€“ on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. [Walt points to the bruise on his face left by Hank in "Blood Money."] I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.

Game basically about shooting the infected aka zombies but with special zombies that attack you in different ways.
Like, the boomer vomiting on you, their vomit attracts zombies and blurs your vision you for a moment.
Then there's the smoker that will choke you with it's tongue, meaning you get incapacitated, and you have to wait for your teammates to help you, so you can move again and shoot zombies.
Can also get lots of achievements, play different modes, and co-op which, I'm up for.

Old Fashioned Pumpkin Pie

2 large eggs
1 large egg yolk
1/2 cup packed dark brown sugar
1/3 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1/8 teaspoon cardamom
1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest
2 cups pumpkin purÃ©e from a sugar pumpkin (see Recipe Note) OR 1 (15-ounce can) pumpkin purÃ©e (can also use purÃ©ed cooked butternut squash)
1 1/2 cups heavy cream or 1 (12-ounce) can evaporated milk
1 homemade pie crust, chilled or frozen (see pÃ¢te brisÃ©e recipe or our no-fail flaky pie crust recipe), or 2 pre-made pie shells

Preheat the oven:
Preheat your oven to 425Â°F.
Make the filling:
Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Mix in the brown sugar, white sugar, salt, spices â€” cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, ground cloves, cardamom, and lemon zest.
Mix in the pumpkin purÃ©e. Stir in the cream. Beat together until everything is well mixed.
mixing pumpkin pie ingredients
pumpkin pie ingredients mixed well
adding cream to pumpkin pie puree
pumpkin pie filling ready to add to pie
Fill the pie shell and bake:
Pour the filling into an uncooked chilled or frozen pie shell. Bake at a high temperature of 425Â°F for 15 minutes.
Then after 15 minutes, lower the temperature to 350Â°F. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes more. The pie is done when a knife tip inserted in the center comes out wet but relatively clean. The center should be just barely jiggly.
(About half-way through the baking, you may want to put foil around the edges or use a pie protector to keep the crust from getting too browned.)
Note that the pumpkin pie will come out of the oven all puffed up (from the leavening of the eggs), and will deflate as it cools.
pumpkin pie in dish ready for baking
Baked Pumpkin Pie From Scratch
Cool the pie on a rack, then serve:
Cool the pumpkin pie on a wire rack for 2 hours.
Serve with whipped cream.

An amazing horde shooter! The special infected are creative - they have their weaknesses, but they all have a distinct purpose. The campaing are amazing too! Each level of a campaign has a challenge in it. These can range from burning a barrier to starting a rock concert and every one is special and unique! The campaings are all rememberable. The game also gives a lot of interaction beetween the survivor players by making them talk, respond to a problem and even change their friedships between each other! There is a lot more amazing stuff this game has to offer, so I highly recomend buying this game and seeing for yourself. :)

almost a millennia ago my mother and i used to play this game on her laptop on a hill, i was so young back then but i still remember the howling winds and the strange animals walking through the towering trees, at one point i even got attacked by a small bear, but nothing could stop me from playing this game, even if i won the lottery and had to raise my head from the screen so they could verify my identity i wouldn't budge. its almost like i can hear faint voices calling upon me to get up, one of them sound very close to my mothers voice, which also sounds like my voice. that would make scene since my mother has left me because i couldn't stop the game to respond to her not even once, i now live in endless misery due to my own incompetence. anyways good game 10/10 would play again

This game is a timeless classic, and although the game has aged really well, many of the people who still play it really bring the whole game down. Certain members of the community (like Khomchik) have inspired players to treat the game as a competitive free-for-all, rather than a cooperative survival shooter. You'll constantly be running into speedrunners and griefers who ruin the game, even in the co-op campaign, unless you bring friends along to kick them out. Be nice to your fellow survivors and help them out, especially if they're new. If new players get scared off by the so-called "professionals", then this game won't have a strong community for much longer.

This game is solid but frustrating. I think that the AI difficulty definitely got increased in this game from its predecessor and your teammate AI also got dumbed down pretty considerably.

I think the sandbox and cast of characters is more fun than the first Left 4 Dead game, plus you have a bigger campaign selection than the first game, but once again the steep increase in difficulty (or maybe I'm just not that great at the game) is one of those things that makes the experience kind of frustrating overall.

I definitely think this game is great and it's a timeless classic, just more frustrating than I remember.

i remember one time my buddy keith put his hand in the tailpipe of a pickup truck and boy he was stuck like a toad in a pickle jar. We didnt have no tools to cut him out so I called up his cousin who owns a tow truck. Now let me tell you, keiths cousin is dumber than the gators in his backyard, because he went right ahead and hooked up the pickup truck and started to drive away. Man you shoulda seen the look on keiths face when the truck started movin, he about saw the lord himself. Keiths cousin couldnt hear keith screamin bloody murder in the back over the radio, so he went drivin all the way back to Savannah! Keith suppose to be in that wheelchair for about 4 months, but 1 week later he said that it was all healed up. Just goes to show how much of a champ keith is.

Left 4 Dead 2 is one of the best zombie games of all time. For a game that released back in 2009 the graphics, sounds, and music quality is still topnotch today (2022). The Workshop mods make this game twice as good.

Also if you have the time. People need to start demanding Valve to make Left 4 Dead 3.

"Hello, hello? Uh, I wanted to record a message for you to help you get settled in on your first night. Um, I actually worked in that office before you. I'm finishing up my last week now, as a matter of fact. So, I know it can be a bit overwhelming, but I'm here to tell you there's nothing to worry about. Uh, you'll do fine. So, let's just focus on getting you through your first week. Okay?
Uh, let's see, first there's an introductory greeting from the company that I'm supposed to read. Uh, it's kind of a legal thing, you know. Um, "Welcome to Freddy Fazbear's Pizza. A magical place for kids and grown-ups alike, where fantasy and fun come to life. Fazbear Entertainment is not responsible for damage to property or person. Upon discovering that damage or death has occurred, a missing person report will be filed within 90 days, or as soon property and premises have been thoroughly cleaned and bleached, and the carpets have been replaced."

Blah blah blah, now that might sound bad, I know, but there's really nothing to worry about. Uh, the animatronic characters here do get a bit quirky at night, but do I blame them? No. If I were forced to sing those same stupid songs for twenty years and I never got a bath? I'd probably be a bit irritable at night too. So, remember, these characters hold a special place in the hearts of children and we need to show them a little respect, right? Okay.

So, just be aware, the characters do tend to wander a bit. Uh, they're left in some kind of free roaming mode at night. Uh... Something about their servos locking up if they get turned off for too long. Uh, they used to be allowed to walk around during the day too. But then there was The Bite of '87. Yeah. I-It's amazing that the human body can live without the frontal lobe, you know?

Uh, now concerning your safety, the only real risk to you as a night watchman here, if any, is the fact that these characters, uh, if they happen to see you after hours probably won't recognize you as a person. They'll pr- they'll most likely see you as a metal endoskeleton without its costume on. Now since that's against the rules here at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, they'll probably try to...forcefully stuff you inside a Freddy Fazbear suit. Um, now, that wouldn't be so bad if the suits themselves weren't filled with crossbeams, wires, and animatronic devices, especially around the facial area. So, you could imagine how having your head forcefully pressed inside one of those could cause a bit of discomfort...and death. Uh, the only parts of you that would likely see the light of day again would be your eyeballs and teeth when they pop out the front of the mask, heh.

Y-Yeah, they don't tell you these things when you sign up. But hey, first day should be a breeze. I'll chat with you tomorrow. Uh, check those cameras, and remember to close the doors only if absolutely necessary. Gotta conserve power. Alright, good night."

It's better than Back 4 Blood because Valve did quality control on this and it shows.  They did details that still stand up to this day and while you may not notice them, your brain does, and it will know if something looks or feels off.

Shoot guns in a dark tunnel?  Muzzle flashes actually light up the area, and that brief light even casts shadows.  Dead zombies float on water.  Many objects that move or break when you hit or shoot them.  Etc.  Valve even hired actors and used motion capture to make zombies and survivors move in a believable way.

This is a Pretty Decent First Person Shooter.  For an F.P.S.; It's fairly easy to learn, Cultivates Comradeship in Multiplayer Scenarios, and does give you a sense of accomplishment when you've completed a difficult scenario.  I found that after a frustrating day; it's almost a relief to get off: "A Few Hundred Bursts on some Zombies and Ugly Creatures"......but, that's just me.  It's a fun game, it's enduring well, Our Friends at Valve did a Great Job.                                                                                                           Recommendations:  Learn to use everything at your disposal well.  Check Your Targets before you Burst. Stay Moving, and be ready to duck into good defensive positions at any time.  Be Aggressive, Don't be Cow'd, Take the fight to them as much as you can.......because you still gain ground.  Always fire in Bursts, Reload Every Chance you Get, Always keep a full mag.  Alway......and I mean Always Stay Together, and if you can't.....pair up.  Everyone Team up on Specialty Creatures(They're the Real Threat).  Lastly; Use Good Clean Combat Movement if you can, and when stopped: Use,Line, Half Circle,and Alamo. Be ready to Kneal(CTRL Key)...so that you may take advatage of Firepower Redundancy.   Our Team Leader is: "CREED", "ELVIS" is Back......and Dropping Undead Left and Right.  I am "Whitetalon"......I'll Catch You in Drift My Friends.

I've been playing this game since I was a kid. On the 360 this game was amazing, and today on PC it remains as one of my favorite and most played games of all time. Every detail in the world and every aspect of gameplay is just fantastic, as well as the characters and their VAs. With the "director" controlling how each campaign plays out, almost every time you start up a game, it can feel completely different from your last playthrough, which gives even more incredible replay-ability. The day I'm writing this, I actually experienced a tank spawn in dead air which I've never seen before. It's incredible after countless hours of killing infected and surviving finals, I keep coming back. Personally, my favorite campaign is No Mercy, but each campaign is actually really good besides like 2. They each try something new, and add a new atmosphere to your surroundings. Another addition is how story telling is told through the world, by drawings on walls, posters, or even an entire building. Overall, I really recommend this game, which still holds it's standards after 10+ years. If you're looking for a "zombie" shooting game, this is the one. Please don't pick Back 4 Blood over this-

The AI for humans is beyond awful, like I really don't get how it can be so bad. 

There are issues with the game design like how in versus mode you can't take a break even if you have been playing for an hour straight. This is so simple to fix to, like having a mandatiry cooldown every two rounds or something.

And worst of all is the community, it is extremely toxic. You will either end up with: 

a) Elitists who will kick you for the dumbest or most minor of reasons. Last night I was kicked because a person who clearly cannot speak english tried to tell me something through voice-chat and I simply couldn't understand him. This also brings me to the issue of how easy it is to abuse the vote kick. If someone has atleast one friend in the team then they simply won't be able to be kicked out no matter how much they f@ck with the team. If they have 2 friends then you are completely at the mercy of their caprice.

 or b) you will end up in servers full of people who don't know how to play the game which is logical to happen when the environment is so hostile to learning.

There is so no place for those who are neither experts nor noobs.

Simply put, the game has not been an enjoyable expirience. It is painfully clear to me now that it is a game explicitly designed to be played with friends, people who you know and can chat with. Unless you have friends which are willing to play this game with you then I am afraid this is simply not worth it. 

TLDP; DON'T buy the game if you plan to play online with random strangers.

My goodness. Where do I even begin? Let's start with the fast and easy answer first. Left 4 Dead 2 is an absolutely phenomenal game. I really recommend this to everyone! A personal 8.3/10. 



But let's get into the details on what I think of Left 4 Dead 2.

â€¢ The gameplay. What can I say? It's a blast to play, with multiple game modes. And maps. There is also a large number of custom campaigns and maps. There are thousands of community-made things in the workshop! If you ever get bored of the standard gameplay loop or if the game is too easy, there are a lot of things you can change with mods! If the game is too easy, then. I would recommend these [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1675287324] difficulties [/url] made by lizvullok! But other than that. I would give the gameplay a solid 7.6/10

â€¢ The community. A solid 10/10, if you exclude the bad side of course. But the player-base is a wonderful community! There is an amazing. Wiki to look at if you need information, and players usually help answer questions for newer players, and don't forget about the guides! There are a ton of guides to read about ranging. From information about the special infected all the way to the fine details of the weapons! So a perfect 10/10!

â€¢ The sound effects. Like it's spot on, they absolutely nailed the sound design for Left 4 Dead 2! The ambient to the hoard theme, and not to mention the special infected sounds. They are truly terrifying. One of my personal favorites is the witch sounds. It just sends a chill down my spine every time I hear her! A solid 9.6/10!

â€¢ The infected. One of my favorite zombie games and the common zombies are really unique! And then you have the special infected. All of them provide a unique danger to you and your team! For example, we have the boomer. They will explode on death and will puke on you and your team. Which causes normal infected to come and beat you to death. Which will fall under the infected support list! Then you have the Hunter, a beast at picking off people. They will jump into the air and ponce on any survivor. And quickly and efficiently kill them off unless killed and/or shoved off the person! An amazing, set of dangers for you and your team and a solid 8.4/10

â€¢ The weapons. And finally the butter to the sandwich! The weapons you have at your disposal! Ranging from Shotguns, AR, Snipers, and more! and you also have melee weapons to choose from too! But be aware. You can only have either a pistol or a melee weapon. Not both. But either way, you can choose your own playstyle! So go beat up the zombies with a bloody golf club! and while you'r at it, decapitate them! A beautiful 9.4/10!

I really enjoy Left 4 Dead 2, it's one of my personal ways to release my anger, But hey. I'm just a person on the internet so go do what you want to do! Go blow up things in a different game who cares! It's your own life bro. Go have fun.

-Dreamy Lunar

One of the best zombie games I've ever played. Bought this at 14 years old and I'm about to turn 23 this year. Not only is the lore vague and yet specific enough to leave you fascinated and guessing, but the characters have personality and really fun dynamics. I especially love Nick and Ellis together. There's not much else to say, I just love L4D2. There's a reason why it's so popular to this day. It never gets boring and mods make it even better.

[h1]The Best Zombie/Horde Shooter Ever[/h1]

One of, if not my most favourite games of all time. I don't have a single bad thing to say about L4D2.

Born before the major take-off of lootcrates and micro-transactions, L4D2 is pure co-operative fun. Loveable characters, wonderful level-design, fantastic voice acting, satisfying gun-play; it's truly perfect in every way. The amount of attention to detail that goes into Valve games aren't lost on anyone, and L4D2 is no exception. 100's of voice-lines, animations and dynamic situations keep this game a blast to play to this very day.

L4D2 comes with the famous "AI Director", a scripted artificial intelligence that changes and enhances your gameplay based on how well you and your team are doing, and the current situation. Doing too well? The director will ramp up the difficulty. Struggling with that one level? After a few restarts and deaths, the AI Director actually takes pity on your team, and will be a little more forgiving going forward, spawning more guns, and triggering less random events.

The game is a blast from start to finish, bring your friends for more fun as you'll need to rely on them just as much and they will need to rely on you. There's honestly nothing to dislike. No lengthy loading screens. No weird forced XP systems. No nonsense. Just boot the game up, shoot and ask questions later. 

Truly one of the best games I have ever played, and still do play. There's just nothing like it, and I love it. Oh, and it also has Steam Workshop support, allowing for 1000's upon 1000's of mods. You can modify and change the game to your heart's content.

This game is a lot of fun. The game is full of memorable, heartbreaking, and funny moments. There is a section where you are in a stadium and you are waiting for rescue to arrive, there are zombies everywhere around you, so you start defend yourselves while rock music plays in the background. It is one of if not the best zombie shooter in existence (besides Undead Nightmare, but that's a DLC). It has an amazing community which will be glad to help new players. The game also has an impressively big modding community. You can download a mod which will turn the Tank class into Shrek. The gameplay is so addicting and unique. For example, when you right-click your mouse, you don't scope in like 99% of shooters but instead you shove. The maps are distinct and memorable. My favorite being Dark Carnival. The game has several different game modes like: Campaign, Single player, Survival, Versus, Survival Versus, Realism, Realism Versus, and Scavenge (there might be some more but I can't remember them). If you are a parent and you are wondering if you you should or should not allow your child to play this game then I'd say that this game is 12+. There is blood, gore, and swearing. However there is a mod which gets rid of the blood. If you don't want any gore then I recommend that you download the Minecraft Zombies Mod (last time I checked the mod doesn't have any dismemberment). I don't think that there is a mod which sensors out the swears. Who knows, maybe someone has already made a censoring mod and I'm just stupid. No matter who you are, I believe that you will enjoy this game. It is a lot better than Back4Bloood, I'll tell you that much.

Hello, hello? Uh, I wanted to record a message for you to help you get settled in on your first night. Um, I actually worked in that office before you. I'm finishing up my last week now, as a matter of fact. So, I know it can be a bit overwhelming, but I'm here to tell you there's nothing to worry about. Uh, you'll do fine. So, let's just focus on getting you through your first week. Okay?Uh, let's see, first there's an introductory greeting from the company that I'm supposed to read. Uh, it's kind of a legal thing, you know. Um, "Welcome to Freddy Fazbear's Pizza. A magical place for kids and grown-ups alike, where fantasy and fun come to life. Fazbear Entertainment is not responsible for damage to property or person. Upon discovering that damage or death has occurred, a missing person report will be filed within 90 days, or as soon property and premises have been thoroughly cleaned and bleached, and the carpets have been replaced."

Blah blah blah, now that might sound bad, I know, but there's really nothing to worry about. Uh, the animatronic characters here do get a bit quirky at night, but do I blame them? No. If I were forced to sing those same stupid songs for twenty years and I never got a bath? I'd probably be a bit irritable at night too. So, remember, these characters hold a special place in the hearts of children and we need to show them a little respect, right? Okay.

So, just be aware, the characters do tend to wander a bit. Uh, they're left in some kind of free roaming mode at night.Uh...Something about their servos locking up if they get turned off for too long. Uh, they used to be allowed to walk around during the day too. But then there was The Bite of '87. Yeah. I-It's amazing that the human body can live without the frontal lobe, you know?

Uh, now concerning your safety, the only real risk to you as a night watchman here, if any, is the fact that these characters, uh, if they happen to see you after hours probably won't recognize you as a person. They'll p-most likely see you as a metal endoskeletonwithout its costume on. Now since that's against the rules here at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, they'll probably try to...forcefully stuff you inside a Freddy Fazbear suit. Um, now, that wouldn't be so bad if the suits themselves weren't filled with crossbeams, wires, and animatronic devices, especially around the facial area. So, you could imagine how having your head forcefully pressed inside one of those could cause a bit of discomfort...and death. Uh, the only parts of you that would likely see the light of day again would be your eyeballs and teeth when they pop out the front of the mask, heh.

Y-Yeah, they don't tell you these things when you sign up. But hey, first day should be a breeze. I'll chat with you tomorrow. Uh, check those cameras, and remember to close the doors only if absolutely necessary. Gotta conserve power. Alright, good night.

    2 durabase solid drawers are great to store all of your family's favorite foods; easily removable for cleaning
    Smart diagnosis helps the service center diagnose problems over the phone, helping you troubleshoot quickly
    Premium LED lighting in the refrigerator and freezer section offer long-lasting bright light
    4-door French door design has 2 refrigerator doors and 2 freezer drawers
    Satin-smooth stainless steel finish is resistant to fingerprints and easily wipes clean with a soft, dry cloth
    Inverter linear compressor is backed by a 10-year limited warranty
    For optimal results, replace water filter every 6 months (LT1000PC)
    Click here to learn more about Eco Options and Energy Efficiency

This game is 13 years old, yet any co-op focused FPS has yet to top it. Whether it's the addictive game play, the incredible attention to detail, or the insanely customizable (and rather insane) mods on offer, nothing else comes close.

Scenario: 4am. The hordes just keep coming. Your Caprisun? Empty. Your pizza lunchable? Mutilated. Mozzarella shrapnel is scattered about your lack of chest hair. Someday, you whisper under your breath, God willing if your father has passed down the right pair of genes, a luscious chests fro will rise from this mixture of white cheese and Flaming Hot Cheeto ash.  Sweat beads drip down your temple. You clench, but a gaseous cloud escapes your rectum. When will this end? You think to yourself. Has it been days? Weeks?  Who am I? Where did this Oreo come from? Were there Oreos in that lunchable? Your pet lizard Whiskers seems to  have escaped captivity. There's no time. He was a brave soul, but not all hope is lost. The Last Stand is here, but your bowels are failing. Was the Code Red Mountain Dew really a good choice for dinner? Probably not. But you're a solider. No one notices your sacrifices. You're doing this for the rest of the world. Why can't anyone see that? The door bursts open! Another fart escapes with a clap. You're mother is there, furious. "ROBERT NIGEL MCDOODLEBOTTOM IT'S 8:30 YOU SHOULD'VE BEEN IN BED 30 MINUTES AGO!" 8:30? Why did you think it was 4am? What is time? She never understands. You've crossed the bridge, but production at the turd factory is at an all time high. Maybe you should've made those modifications to your sweet gaming chair. A 5 gallon bucket underneath that seat would work wonders right now. But alas sacrifices must be made again. This one is for you Whiskers. Your Garfield underwear are stricken with the skidmarks of war. You pass the Porta-Johns as you grow near the extraction zone and think I could really use you right now, Portable Johnson. Rochelle goes down. Not again, you can see the chopper. A hero never leaves anyone behind. You feel a piece of beef jerky stuck in your teeth. No one said this would be easy. As she regains consciousness, its now or never.  You make a break for the heli. Your assult rifle is singing louder than Gloria Estefan at a Superbowl halftime show. You only watch for the commercials anyways. As you finally board the chopper a sigh of relief is heard. A true masterpiece that withstood the test of time. Even if you were in the Twilight Zone.

I don't think I would be able to add anything more to say to the countless other reviews that others have left on this masterpiece of a game. Words cannot do enough justice to describe the technical and artistic quality of this game. It is albeit a relatively dated one considering the current generational demographic, but nevertheless, this game is a legend. I recently decided to buy this game to reminisce the days I spent with my friends as we played hardcore runs of the co-op campaigns, and the game plays as fun as it felt in my memories. Buy this game ASAP if zombies and co-op makes you smile. You won't regret it.
