My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably deadâ€“ murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time â€“ something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange â€“ uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" â€“ on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. [Walt points to the bruise on his face left by Hank in "Blood Money."] I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.

I played online a little, and from my experience there were still quite a few players who got through full campaigns, they were helpful, polite and experienced. seems to be a cult following of respectful players. That my experience anyway,
But the modding community is really what makes this game worth buying. Left 4 Dead would be (ahem) dead to me by now if not for the mods you can install to replace enemies, survivors, sounds, weapons, etc, and there are new campaigns to play through as well. The mods add a whole new experience, and I wish more games had such options. You can change the blood color to green or blue, replace zombies with terminators, Mars Attacks Martians, stormtroopers, ZOMBIE stormtroopers, Alien Xenomorphs, Quake Strogg, the list goes on. You can even get basters from Star Wars, with laser blasts and everything. Although don't get me wrong, original Left 4 Dead games are classics, the excitement of bonding with well-designed and developed teammates, both AI and/or other humans if you have them, the levels to explore and the engagement and the super detailed graphics are all great, but I wouldn't have bothered to come back and start playing this again in 2022 if not for the Steam Workshop. I sure hope Back 4 Blood has some modding support in the future, I'd definitely buy Back 4 Blood if they have a buncha mods to play around with.

Is that something imparted by the infection, because none of the survivors can climb over a damn fence to shut off the perpetual-horde-summoning noisemaker?  

So no.  Thumbs down.

[b]My background[/b]: huge fan of first-person shooters.

[b]What I like about Left 4 Dead 2[/b]: the variety of the Versus gamemode. I'm only usually playing two campaigns (each consisting of five maps) â€” you'd think the game would become stale at some point in time. 111 hours in, Iâ€™m finding it more and more interesting as Iâ€™m finally at a point when the symphony of working together with your human teammates against your human opponents comes together and it just clicks: 

Walk through the corridor to avoid getting detected by the Infected â†’ restock ammo â†’ rush through the zombie horde to the next point â†’ choose which teammate to save first â†’ keep a safe distance from a Boomer â†’ shove a Hunter away mid-pounce â†’ cut a Smokerâ€™s tongue â†’ get pinched by a Charger â†’ GG! Close match and all eight players had fun.

[b]What I dislike about Left 4 Dead 2[/b]: not much. With no proper matchmaking system, veteran players and newbies are often placed together â€” and thatâ€™s a recipe for a conflict, which usually ends in kicking players out. Also, some special infected mechanics (e.g. precise pouncing by Hunters or throwing rocks by Tanks) feel intimidating at first.

Left 4 Dead 2
-------------------------

Can't stress this enough: There are a lot of little things that this game does right that can't quite be found anywhere else. It's truly withstood the test of time, and I keep finding myself coming back to the game to scratch that itch that most 4-player Co-Op games are just never quite able to scratch.
It should go without saying that this game is well worth the full price, but if you are still on the fence, this game has gone on sale fairly often.
Regardless, I've enjoyed my time with this game thoroughly! Please give it a try if you have any interest in shooters and/or co-op!

I can't believe that I haven't written a review for L4D2 till now!
Do I recommend it? Hell yea!
Do I think it is an amazing game? Of course! It is a masterpiece of a game! Even now, after 13 years from its release, the game community is struggling to develop a game that's near it. You can find stuff "coming near it", but never matching its grade.

However, the only downside of this game is that it took the trend of action more than horror. If you played L4D1 you will notice it is more a horror game than an action game. While L4D2 took the trend of action with adding new weapons, melee weapons, adding more grenade types and so on.

All that aside, L4D2 rules all zombie games, with no competition. Games like World War Z and Back 4 Blood are trying to reach the stars, but L4D2 made the competition so fierce that no one could do it.

This game is litty. So let's get something straight; I'm not racist. We got that? Can I continue? Okay, thanks! This game is so stupid and bad but that's what makes it so fun half the time. One minute you're setting yourself on fire with spicy juice the next you're getting tongued, what's not to love? There's a nice variety of zombies, such as, Adult film star (Spitter), Lung Cancer (Smoker), Allahu Akbar (Boomer), Jockey, The Cooler Jockey (Hunter) and my least favorite, chronic masterbature (Charger). We also have the tank but who cares about that gorilla. The campaign is really short, we can probably beat both games in a single afternoon, however the replay value is high for me. I hate first person shooter games because I'm bad at them but in this game..... Yeah I'm still bad but the AI carries me so it balances out. The game is fun especially with friends. Playing the campaign with friends is lit but playing the campaign with the cpu makes you want to tie your dick in a knot. Recently I've been playing Versus more because it's the only good game mode. Controlling the zombies and cumming all over your friends with Boomer is so satisfying *wink* but I will admit, the game mode is not balanced at all. What else can I say? Valve knows how to make great number 2s and they seem that they can't count higher than 2. Portal 2, Team Fortress 2, Left 4 dead 2 and Half Life 2 *sniff* there will never be a sequel to any of these games will there? Solid game would recommend. 2/10

I like how the game relies on teamwork and strategy to make it through the game. Basically one surviving player will not last long by himself/herself. However this is a double edged sword, as now if you have a bad team member that does not contribute, it brings down the whole gaming experience! Especially if there are two of them that are just clueless. Still this is an amazing game and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys zombie type survival games.

Amazing next gen flashlight shadows, superb gunplay, a vast variety of special zombies, pristine death animations for common zombies, interesting map design ... my friend and I, again, are back 4 blood in this masterpiece of a game.

Years of playing on the 360, now I have mods to make my childhood even better!

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably deadâ€“ murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time â€“ something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange â€“ uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" â€“ on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. [Walt points to the bruise on his face left by Hank in "Blood Money."] I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.

I missed the initial hype for L4D, but I decided to get this last Lunar Year sale for like Â£1 and In the 22 hours I've played, I have absolutely fallen in love with this game. I've spent most of my time playing with my friends and it's always an amazing time, only made better when my mod illiterate friend and I discovered the community made mods, now all the zombies are Neco-arcs, Coach is Fat Albert and my guns moan, L4D2 is truly a masterpiece. I've also played a little bit of the game solo, just to appreciate the writing, animations, level design and everything else lost amongst the noise Shrek as the Tank, and while I already knew Valve were masterclass artists in their craft, L4D2 really demonstrates this with it's famously 780 ways Zombies can die, still impressive graphics and astonishingly expressive facial animations. L4D2 is an absolute masterpiece and still maintains one of the best zombie games ever made. And yes, it's leagues better than Back 4 Blood.

This game is amazing. I played this game on the 360, and even on console I enjoyed it very much. One of the benefits of getting it on PC is the mods. There is literally hundreds of thousands of mods you could download, from audios, re textures, (my favorite) gun skins, to even whole playable CAMPAIGNS. And there are more mods being created everyday. Not to mention how easy it is to install them. I strongly recommend this game because of the infinite fun. The multiplayer scene is also good, the most people I have ever seen playing this game is around 23k (pretty sure this was like a month ago). My favorite game mode is survival (my best time is around 12 minutes lol). Oh yeah and they literally have all the l4d1 campaigns and characters so that makes it even more worth it. All in all this game is great, fun to play by yourself but even more fun to play with friends. 11/10

FACT: Valve games are great games. Hundreds of thousands of people are still playing their games, even though they were published more than ten years ago. CS 1.6, Half Life, CS:GO, Portal, Alien Swarm, Dota 2, Team Fortress 2. And Left 4 Dead 2 is no different from those that I just mentioned. It is basically a co-op zombie killing game with an interesting story to follow, and decent characters to play (Coach, my favorite dude!). There are normal infected, and special infected (Jockey, my worst enemy!). 9 on 10 from me.

Obviously great game, has been out long enough that I think everyone is well aware of what the game is like. Not anything I can add.

Horrible, horrible community. There are of course friendly people, and they are easy enough to find when playing anything cooperative. If you have interest in anything versus, though, you are likely going to be constantly kicked, berated, and without any real kind of feedback. The experience has been overall horrible, the worst from any game I've ever played. I understand why people may feel frustrated, but if I am not given any feedback and instead am just kicked over and over, I'm just going to stop playing. This is probably why there are so few games running at any time at this point.

Left 4 Dead 2 is another first person shooter game, but with a zombie theme.

The player character is a survivor of the zombie outbreak, the only human survivor of the entire ordeal.

The player starts with a single pistol and a light backpack.

There are several types of weapons available, ranging from assault rifles, shotguns, and sniper rifles.

All weapons have different damage types, the player can find different types of ammo in the game.

The player can also find different types of health kits and bandages, with varying healing effects.

In the original Left 4 Dead, health kits have a finite amount of healing power, and if a player runs out of the health kits they must be restocked.

This game doesn't even need any more validation at this point. It has proven itself to be one of the best of its kind.
Insane replay value thanks to the ai director or whatever the devs were talking about in their commentary video. The characters' everchanging dialogue really make you feel immersed in the game. All the survivors have their own unique, likeable character except for Rochelle but she has been played by players who save me from jocky enough time that i don't really mind her. 

Why write a review about it then if it doesn't need any validation? 
Because when a game that has been made with so much passion and care for their players has been claimed to have ANYTHING to do with a new shitty, money-grubbing, passionless game like black 4 butts, you should be offended. When their promotion material contain a cocky girl who follow the rules of "Tell, don't show" because they don't believe the audience has any shred of ability to infer and understand any subtle cue and dialogue from their characters, you should be offended. Today's game standard has been on decline sooo much lately and when a certain tortoise studio game try to ride over the fame of a legendary game that they hardly have contributed anything to, it shouldn't be tolerated. There should be consequences. 

I remember one time they gave interview that they want to make it "Bigger and better"

And here allow me to response in Coach's deep manly voice.
"Hah! Better maa ass"

It's strange how a game that has no rewards system or any sort of tier/level thing can be one of the best zombie games of all time with a replay ability that can keep old and new players hooked. There's something so visceral about this game that makes you have fun, be on the edge of your seat and not give a care about some sort of reward, at the same time. The reward is a hell of a good time. Even the AI still holds up as intelligence, knowing when to help not just you, but each other, going into safe houses when you arrive at your destination instead of standing outside forever. Just expect them to focus on healing you more than run away from the tank with you. It's you and/or your friends slashing through zombies with randomized dangers hopping out of well crafted and designed maps. With a few bits of references, secrets, lore, mutations and fun achievements, even support from a massive modding community, Left 4 Dead 2 will always be a special gem for most people.

First... all you noobs saying "I cant find my way around" "Map's are terrible, I get lost"... you're just retarded stop eating lead paint chips and pay attention. It's very simple my 12 year old sister has beaten the Campaign numerous times on Advanced and Expert. I personally have not experienced any major bugs... or any minor bugs. Of course there are some map glitches, Like DC-1 you can jump the second floor of the hotel, and thus cheat the infected from being able to reach you. But... that's minor. And I'm sure in Competitive (cal/cevo) play it's not allowed. And most casual gamers don't use the glitch, if they even know about it. Actually it seems like the Competitive teams are the one who use it, go figure. Anyway... this is obviously not an expansion, and in no way, shape, or form should of been a DLC. This should of definitely been a sequel. Rushed? Maybe... High Quality, Action Packed, Suspenseful, Fun, Co-Op Survival? ABSOLUTELY. Hands down, BEST ZOMBIE GAME TOO DATE. The original was already amazing, but this game definitely expanded the gameplay, and added a nice new story to it. Originally I was put off, thinking this might be a buggy piece of DLC trash with some Lipstick on it, But that is definitely not the case. You people crying need to find a girlfriend... Or get a job so you can earn some money to buy this game and stop being so jealous. And that's another thing... it's not like Valve is out to get your money, they make a quality game, and market it, If you don't want to buy it, DON'T. Simple as that, they aren't holding you up, they're selling a product that they worked hard on. And... all you people talking about Lazy Coding/Programming... I do it for a living, and all work done on this game is of High Quality. Sure sometimes you take shortcuts, but the new weapons and new uncommon common were done beautifully and in no-way did I feel like i was wielding the same weapon with a different skin, or fighting the same zombie with a different outfit. Bottom Line, Great game, WORTH EVERY PENNY
